title: You won’t sleep
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice Hotel
review: This hotel is located on a dreary backstreet with half a sidewalk and an overall hidden feeling. And perhaps that is for the better because this appears to be the hotel you book if there are absolutely no other options. This was the case for me, as I am traveling with someone who refuses to trust Airbnb.   Everything is extremely old, from the doors to the doorknobs to the sinks to the night stands. Small rooms. Bizarrely small closets. Dirty, worn down bathrooms. The most unpleasant, uncomfortable beds known to man and sheets that feel like thick paper. I’m not sure if I hate the sheets or the pillows more.   It’s the sheets. But the pillows are terrible too and two of them stacked will still feel remarkably bad.  The comforters are old and dusty and there’s an extra haphazardly shoved into one of the shelves in case you like double the sadness.  The one saving grace is that my complete inability to sleep tonight may lead to some sleep tomorrow, despite the severe discomfort of this bed. Prayers up for that.…

title: Wonderful stay at Londra
review: We stayed at the Hotel Londra in Florence for two nights during a group tour of Italy.  We found it to be a nice hotel in a good location.  It is only a 15-20 minute walk to the City Center.  The hotel was very clean, the staff nice and accommodating.  It was unusually warm for Florence apparently but the air conditioning was working.

title: Great Breakfast but Otherwise Outdated
review: We chose this hotel as they are AIC certified and my wife has several food allergies with Gluten allergy being the most serious one. This is a good hotel and very close to the train station. They are very well aware of food allergies and their restaurant staff took excellent care of my wife. Roberto in particular was great and took personal care of my wife's food allergies because of which our stay in Florence was wonderful. They even gave us an upgrade on our room. Very very friendly and honest staff members. We will definitely return to them when revisiting Florence.

title: Hotel Londra Florence (3 Stars)
review: Check-in/out process was easy and staff was friendly. Decent lobby and fantastic breakfast buffet. Very large breakfast area was a must because tour groups often use this hotel so there are a lot of people eating at one time. We had a third person in our room and they had the sofa bed made up for her. The room itself was small but adequate, even for three people. I found the bed to be quite uncomfortable (hard) but my husband thought it was fine. The bathroom was not cleaned well and we found toenail clippings on the floor. Since we arrived later in the evening and were only staying here one night we didn’t bother to ask to move rooms or have it cleaned. The hairdryer looked 20 years old and didn’t do much in the way of drying. This hotel was conveniently located to several touristy areas. Overall, despite the delicious breakfast, I’d probably pick somewhere else to stay if I returned to Florence.…

title: Outdated rooms
review: Let me start by saying how fantastic the breakfast is! It is probably the nicest breakfast buffet that we had during our stay in Tuscany. We stayed there for a few days, did a bit of travelling then came back for one night before leaving. I think we were in an older room the first time and then in a newer or renovated room the second time. I have read some of the reviews (ancient hair dryer...mine in the first room was broken, dated and slightly run down) and I have to agree that maybe the first room we stayed in was more along those lines, but the second room? I think it was one of the loveliest rooms I’ve stayed in. Super modern, quiet, clean and large. So I can only hope that they are in the process of renovating all their rooms because the second room we stayed in was an…

title: A NICE CITY HOTEL
review: Clean rooms, but not 4 star.  Beds not comfortable and room outdated.  The hair dryer is older than I am.  However, staff helpful and main floor area nice.  Breakfast as expected.  The location in Florence convenient.  10-15 minute walk to the Duomo area.

title: Good and bad
review: After reading a few reviews I wondered to my self, did I stay in the same hotel????   We were on a tour and I know the tour companies want a good deal. This was a very adequate hotel. A charming lobby with a very friendly desk staff. Our room was a little plain and the beds seemed a little bit low but that was it. Room 209 was fine! Nice toiletries and really comfortable plush bath sheets. Room was quiet and clean. Nice bar area with free tapas during happy hour. Breakfast was a buffet and had really good pastries.

title: Professionality and Tailored assistance
review: The best things about the hotel are its location and its staff. The desk staff were friendly, helpful, professional, and courteous. Here’s my experience based on two nights last week: Not so good -no bedside wall outlets -no blackout curtains -no peephole  -physical keys rather than cards -low, soft beds -stained rug -very weak water pressure  -only three pillows for two guests -outdated generally   The good things -spacious wardrobe -lots of mirrors  -cute little balcony  -nice selection of hot and cold beverages in the room -pleasant view from the balcony  -excellent breakfast buffet—pancakes! -spacious and welcoming lobby -stylish and comfortable dining and bar areas   Because the bad things most directly affect my sleeping, personal comfort, and sense of safety, I wouldn’t…

title: Exploring Florence
review: This place was selected on TripAdvisor rating and location. Well both were misleading. Location- it is close to railway station.  Ugly and dirty area. Rating-I think this rating is manipulated. Room - my single room was very small.  Actually its balcony was bigger than the free space in the room.  Furniture is old, outdated and worn out.  Isolation is very poor.  You hear every noise, ever step from outside.   Bathroom was old with broken tiles and tiny shower.  The bathtub was with size of app. 120 cm/60 cm.  I did not knew that such size is existing.  Probably it is OK fo kids. Corridors and elevators-old, worn out with smelly, dirty carpets on the floor. Internet is slow.  For VPN connection you ask at the reception for special account. Breakfast not lavish, but generally OK.…

title: Lovely Visit
review: Hotel is very near to main train station,duomo and shopping area.Breakfast was best.Room was clean and well equipped. Staff very cooperative.No iron available though. they did iron the clothes and charged. Entrance of hotel was little spooky and old fashioned though. VAT was included in total bill but it wasn’t refunded nor a a form was given to me despite me asking. I wonder why. 🤷🏻‍♀️

title: Location horrible
review: My Husband and I have just returned from a two day visit to Florence and we stayed at Hotel Londra. Before we went on our trip, I read some of the reviews on Trip Advisor for this hotel and I must admit, it made me quite anxious about staying there! We were pleasantly surprised!! Room was lovely, as nice as any we have stayed in before and the bed very comfortable! The view wasn't anything special, but apart from that it was very nice!The breakfast was also good and we were very happy with our stay!

title: Great location near train/ Bus station with a Garden Bar Oasis
review: Unless you want to be by the train station, the Hotel Londra is a crap hole located in a crap hole.  Awful part of town.  The room and bathroom was spacious but very old and unattractive with red, yes red carpet in the room.  The bathroom shower was impossible to regulate the temperature.  The water was either freezing or scolding.  Would not recommend Hotel Londra.

title: Very good
review: We stayed here as part of a trip. The room was clean and tidy, and there was tea and coffee and an electric kettle provided in the room.   Some things were rather tired though, we could not switch off our bedside lights individually, they were either both on or off, not handy when1 wants to read and the other doesn’t!  We had an over bath shower, and shampoo etc were provided. We had a balcony but it was not clean, I suspect it’s had to keep outside things clean when there is a lot of traffic, but you don’t want to use it if it’s dirty.   Breakfast was also included with usual buffet, continental and hot food. But I don’t think that they were real scrambled eggs, they must have been some sort of reconstituted product by the strange consistency. The filter coffee was always cold…

title: Stayed in room 607. We left with 40 mosquito bites each!
review: Friendly little hotel near to the railway station in Florence.    Florence is not my favourite city in the world but this hotel is convenient to most things.  A bit of a walk to the city centre but take a short cut through the railway station to save time.  Good bar and breakfast at this hotel.  The rooms are quiet thanks to double glazing and the beds are comfortable.

title: Nice spot very close to SMN & town
review: The location is fantastic, but perhaps there’s a reason the price is low and the rooms are not fully booked. Our room didn’t smell too fresh when we arrived (a nonenal, musty smell) and it didn’t look as well-kempt as the booking sites showed. The worst part though, was the fact that at night, there were mosquitos in the room that fed on us. We woke up each morning with new bumps on our faces, arms, and legs, and at night, we’d be slapping ourselves when we heard them buzz by our ears.  Given that we wanted to be well rested during our travels, this turned out to be a terrible place to stay, and we checked out one day early, despite having booked and paid for another night.

title: Good price, nice room
review: Our room was spacious & clean, great view, too. Beds were comfortable. The hotel is within 5 minutes walk of Santa Maria Novella train station & about 15 min walk away from the Duomo. Breakfast was a standard affair of hot & cold buffet, on request you get espresso from the kitchen. Staff was courteous & helpful. All in all, good value for money.

title: Very close to all major attractions
review: Me and my husband had a comfy stay as this hotel has a great location, everything is within walking distance so we had the chance to go back and rest for a couple of hours and return for more walks. Special thanks to Emanuela who gave us great choices to eat and walk, it was not the usual advice or sponsored places but her candid and personal suggestions, so that made the difference. Hope to come back soon.!

title: Good location and very friendly staff
review: The hotel is very close to all major attractions in Florence. Also closer to SMN train station, about five minute on foot. Room is good and the breakfast is also worth for the money. Check-in was very fast. Mr. Mohammed in front office was of good help. There is an underground parking but costs 20 Euro per night.  We felt slightly odd with the below. We had checked out leaving our car in the parking. Came back after a walking tour and getting fresh in the washroom near the lobby. Suddenly the cleaning lady appeared with a cloudy face and murmuring something in Italian showing her displeasure of us using the washroom of which the floor was still not fully dry after cleaning. She guarded the area forcing us to leave quickly. I can't blame her as my shoes made marks on the floor.…

title: Convenient hotel near train station
review: The Londra is close to the main railway station as well as the meeting points for various  tour companies . We had a large room with big windows that open and an electric kettle with coffee and tea replenished daily . Be aware that they cater to large tour groups , and sometimes the dining room can be  quite hectic . The food on the breakfast buffet was not always replenished immediately :  one mornig we waited over 15 minutes for some eggs . There are nightly snacks for bar patrons , and we were given a bag with some food for  breakfast when we hd an early departure. Bring your own Kleenex !

title: Good hotel but small room.
review: This hotel is a convenient location within walking distance (8 minutes) of the train station (no need for a taxi) and the main sights (10-15 minutes) of Florence. It is modern, with comfortable rooms and a cheery dining room. Staff are friendly and efficient. There are minor wrinkles such as not enough power sockets in the room and not all of the sockets that we had functioned properly, and the wifi signal was hit and miss from within the room. But overall, location was a winner, especially if you are using trains. Some rooms have a view of the hills above the rooftops of houses and the disused barracks.

title: Decent location, uncomfortable beds.
review: Not at all what I’d expect from a 4 star hotel. Upon arrival, our door key wouldn’t work. When I called the front desk, I didn’t appreciate the man’s response to my polite request for help. Same experience with a maid who happened to be nearby ~ just rude. I was simply informing the staff that our key didn’t work and that we needed help getting into our room. Furthermore, the locks are outdated (just a regular key that any guest can copy!) & the doors don’t even have a chain lock on the inside, or peephole. It felt unsafe. The room was unbearably HOT, despite the heat being off and the AC not on during this time of year. So uncomfortable. Hair was all over the bed cover, as well as on the bed sheets. Unacceptable. The ONE outlet by our bed didn’t work, the light switch beside…

title: Meet all our needs
review: The hotel is located near to many Florence attractions, but was a bit of a challenge to reach with the car's GPS. Our main problem was the beds, we had a room with two single beds that were very small and uncomfortable. They felt like bad rollaway beds with uneven springs and very little padding.

title: Not My Favorite
review: Spent one night in this hotel while making our way to Rome. The room was clean, airy, and we slept perfectly. It was an easy walk for us to the city centre and Uffizi Gallery, although some may say the Uffizi is too far away. Hotel has a pleasant bar area, with complementary nibbles......nice touch. Breakfast,which was included in our room rate was excellent, with a good selection to choose from,including some very crispy bacon🤗 Hotel is only a few minutes walk to the railway station, so it was simply a matter of wheeling our cases along the street. I general the staff were very helpful with directions and shopping tips, however the waiter in the restaurant during our evening meal and again at breakfast could do with a refresher course in customer care.

title: good comfortable hotel
review: We recently stayed here for two nights.  The hotel may be undergoing some renovation as our room did not look anything like the photos on their website.  If we had not been on a tour, I would have requested another room.  The room seemed dirty as there was old, dirty looking carpet.  They did provide a good breakfast and had a nice bar/lounge area.

title: Great hotel
review: Stayed two nights and pleased with our experience. Very close to train station and busy street but relatively quiet. At first we were unsure of area and the 15-min walk to Duomo but we ultimately felt safe and it was a pleasant walk. Breakfast buffet was very good but cooked/crisp bacon is hard to find. Staff was great at replenishing the buffet. Room was clean and shower/tub was great. Though might be nicer to be close to city center this was a good value and nicely met our needs.

title: Not recommending
review: The hotel is great, with great location, with plenty products on brakefast and perfect access to anywhere. I have spent 3nights here, it is a clean hotel with lot of romanian workers.  That's because is a hotel with many facilities, many rooms they know that the client is important. For me it was a very nice accommodation, I do recommend it!

title: Location is great.
review: There was no iron in the room. They don’t change the bed sheets daily. I realized when I had a sticker stick on the sheet at night and next day when I came back from my tour and room was supposed to be clean I found out the sticker was still there under the blanket on the sheet. And the  Wifi was not working properly.

title: Firenze Sept 2018
review: Hotel is very close to the train station so easy to roll your luggage to and from the train.  Also easy to visit the Duomo and City center.  Comfortable and clean.   Good breakfast.  Lots of choices including eggs and bacon.  We are not fond of the square toilet.  Most uncomfortable! And the shower head sprays too much of the bathroom making it difficult to take a shower. But plenty of hot water and comfortable bed, so overall it is good.

title: The Ugly Duckling
review: a considerable walk (around 10 mins) from the SMN train station to the hotel. if you have a large luggage, you might need to consider other hotels which are in front of of nearer to the train station.  you will not miss the hotel since you will see a series of flags at the hotel facade. room is spacious, clean, and interior is modern, but no toothbrush kit. i am satisfied with the breakfast buffet for having a wider selection as compared to the other hotels we stayed at in italy.

title: Good location but horrible staff
review: First impressions of this hotel from the outside have you thinking -“why on earth are we staying here?” Once inside however everything changes - great little restaurant and bar , spacious , clean and comfortable rooms. Hotel is located adjacent to railway station and is only a 15 minute walk from the touristic areas. Staff were very helpful and polite . A great place to stay.

title: Very nice place
review: Although I am happy with the size of the room and bathroom, the AC does not match that of a four star hotel. It does not circulate around the whole room, leaving the room to be hot and stuffy and uncomfortable. We voiced these concerns to reception and were treated very disrespectfully (by Emanuela and Razwan). Firstly when we called Emanuela to explain that it was too hot she said someone will be up and hung up the phone. Razwan came up and said everything is fine then walked out. We then called down again to reception and were told it’s fine but we can view a new room. We were shown a room which did not match the room we payed for so refused.  We went back down to reception to further voice our concern and discomfort but were told repeatedly that ‘it’s fine and maybe not…

title: Good Location, clean.
review: Very cool i loved the place.  The staff is welcoming and helping. The hotel has gym and sauna 🧖‍♀️. The room is clean and tidy. The breakfast is just yummy 🤤 and has so many variations. Also it’s just 5 minutes walking from the train station and it’s just near to everything in the city. Comparing to the price it’s a perfect choice 👌

title: Location is great
review: The Londra hotel was clean and spacious.  It was in an ok location.  It had a nice breakfast.  We stayed here with the tour group we were with, but it wouldn't be my first choice if I had to pick a hotel in Florence.  Our room was quiet and overlooked an apartment complex.  Rooms facing the street had balconies that overlooked the train tracks and busy street so I'm guessing it was loud.  It is a good 15 minute walk to get to the main square.  There was nothing authentic or historic about this hotel.

title: Good compromise
review: Stayed in quite a few hotels in Italy. This one was just OK. A little dated. There was a rip in the sheets and stains on the chairs. The best thing was the location. So close in the city center and to the train station and bus station for all the tours for us visitors. Because of this I gave the hotel three stars. Beware there are a lot of tour groups staying here. There was one group that was huge from Asia. There are two very small elevators that only fit two people in their luggage. We had to walk up six flights of stairs or wait 20 to 30 minutes to use the elevator. Just saying.

title: Good Location in Florence
review: Close to train station, a bit of a walk (15-25 minutes) to main sights.   Lobby is nice, good bar, nice patio area past bar, breakfast area. Enjoyed the breakfast here better than many we had on our trip.  Room was okay - decent size.  Problem was street car out front woke us. Request a room at the back of the hotel.

title: Good hotel good location
review: The Londra is a nice place, well appointed. Rooms are decent. It sits right on a tram line that runs in front of the place. It has a somewhat small lobby area, and it has a very nice outdoor sitting area. We felt it really did not stand out in any particular way.

title: Decent stay in Florence
review: Well here is a hotel which is not only nice and clean but reasonably priced for Florence! A rarity! My room was fairly basic but very comfortable and clean and breakfast was very good. The staff I dealt with were all friendly and very courteous.

title: Poor customer focus
review: Spent 2 nights in the Londra on a tour. Room was smallish - which I expect for a hotel in an Italian city, but a small deck looking out onto the main street.  Breakfast was the usual buffet for the non-European tourists (full!!).  Dinner was a basic pasta ragu, but the veal was quite good.  To get to the main squares, the Duomo, and that wonderful statue of David, we needed to take a bus.  A spacious bar/TV/lounge area was a great spot to relax and enjoy ourselves post-dinner.

title: Terrible Customer Service - couldn’t even make a booking
review: Very disappointed with service provided by front desk and restaurant staff. Felt like we were a bother to them by wanting to have a drink and some afternoon tea in their back garden. Requested a couple of wine glasses be left in our room and was growled at by the woman at the desk telling us 'you can ask the bar for that!' Extremely rude. Breakfast was nice, rooms were clean and housekeeping staff were the nicest people in the property. 5 min walk to the train station which is the only reason we chose, after the poor service I'd have much preferred a longer walk.

title: First impressions good, but poor bathroom
review: I do recomend it.It was really useful four our trip having the hotel near the train station, so it was really easy to get there walking. Beds and bathroom was really confortable and quiet. It was a very good experience.

title: Nice hotel with comfortable bed and good breakfast
review: Stayed two nights on a tour. Well situated for train station and walking around the city. Good breakfast in a spacious dining area. Also has a dining room adjacent to a garden area, although I did not see anyone eat there. First impression of bedroom was good with a comfortable bed. Achilles heel is a rather cramped bathroom (actually no bath at all). Shower tray has folding doors, and I think the doors were fitted wrongly as they wouldn’t close using the magnetic strips. Shallow tray flooded if showerhead was on any setting over minimum, and the drain in the floor was on the opposite side of the room soaking the tiled floor causing a lethal sloppy surface. Why not make the shower tray the lowest point in the room and use larger drain to take away the water. Also when you sat on…

title: An OK stay.
review: We stayed here for one night on our way down through Italy. The room was comfortable and the rest of the hotel was nice too.   The location is convenient but wouldn't feel the safest. With that said, it's within walking distance of most attractions.  The breakfast was lovely and the staff were all very helpful and friendly.  Only one problem - the shower wasn't great in terms of temperature control. It was either roasting hot or cold. Very difficult to get it to the right temperature.    Would stay here again.

title: Nice contemporary hotel
review: We chose the Londra because of its proximity to the Railway station- only a ten minute stroll. The hotel itself was fine- our room was a reasonable size and decorated in a contemporary style - mostly white with blue LED lighting. We a room at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. Breakfast was good with hot and cold options- the coffee was poor however. WiFi was excellent, the staff were efficient and we'd stay again.

title: Interesting hotel!
review: Looking at the pictures on Tripadvisor I realized how small our room was compared to others. It was clean, simple but with barely enough room between the wall and the end of the bed to get by.    Spacious lobby. Great bar. Nice breakfast buffet with a variety of foods to choose from. Able to serve our touring party of 100 a good dinner. Located near the train station. It was a good walk to the center of town.

title: I thing to complain about- fine
review: I read the mixed room reviews, and want to reiterate.....  For goodness sake ask for a refurbished room.  We are in what has to be the smallest room in the hotel (334).  We arrived late due to flight delays which is no doubt why we were put in this room.  It is clean, has the ameneties that are listed on the website, but to be honest, I would find it hard to swing a cat.  The bed is 4ft 6inches wide.  It is adequate, but in this day and age, I expect beds in a four star hotel to be huge.  There is no room for a bedside table on either side of the bed.  No problem, my husband can easily reach over to the desk in the ‘living area’ that apparently all the rooms have. Only one bedside light too.  There is a big balcony.  Shame it needs a good sweep and sandpaper taken to all the…

title: Comfortable stay near train station
review: We have just had three nights at this Hotel as part of our Insight Tour. This Hotel was a pleasant surprise, not only because it is a good step up from our previous Hotel in Rome, but also that the exterior is pretty “blah”. Once inside it is fine, and the Room that we were allocated was clean, light and had tea and coffee making facilities. The towels were thick, white and lovely to use. Two single beds joined together which seems par for the course in Italy but I was so touched that the Hotel Maid came to service our room and asked so pleasantly if we would like the bed for “married?”. We said yes, although we had joined the two singles together to make a double but the sheets were tucked in so you were effectively in two singles lol. When we got back last night, we were so…

title: Great Location!!! Great Breakfast!!
review: Its a nice comfortable hotel with modern amenities. Situated at 5 minutes walk from Train station (Santa Maria Novella). We had a spacious triple occupancy room with a balcony. Tram route is right in front of hotel, yet there was almost no noise inside room. Thnks to double door at balcony. Generally breakfast is quite basic in Italy hotels but in this hotel Breakfast was good and had plenti of options. Overall pleasing experience.

title: Lovely Florence
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Great hotel
review: Very nice location , tasty cuisine, very nice place ito dine in !   Helpful  and  friendly staff!! Recommended specialy for its location near the station!10 minutes walk to the Duomo! We gone to Tuscany -Siena-Pisa tour from the hotel👍👍must visit !

title: Convenience due to access to Train Station, Taxi and close enough to walk to many attractions
review: I stayed here for two nights.  Great room. Very modern. Great location. We walked to restaurants in the neighborhood. Lots of transportation near by. I would stay again. Breakfast was great. Florence is a great city.

title: Horrible
review: Large room and bathroom. Close to many  businesses.  Great food.  I would highly recommend it.  Very comfortable lobby, take advantage of a good place to read , catch up on e-mail, etc. We were traveling with a large group and everyone was pleased with the service and food.

title: Good location, bad wi-fi, okay shower/bath and great breakfast
review: My room was like a hostal from a horror movie! The room was the most terrifying experience in my last 15 yrs traveling to Europe! If you don’t get the refurbished rooms you won’t be able to sleep!!!!!!!

title: Good depending on what room you stay. Excellent breakfast.
review: very smart, all you could expect in its class. Modern style and real nice and warm, hard to get in the parking, one needs to turn in sharp left before passing main door, otherwise you have drive round and that is not a given task ! very good restaurant but not cheap ! staff was very friendly and helpful on many occasions. slight disappointment was the fact that they did not replenish the milk and tea bags in the room; when I telephoned on the last morning, it did not work as my Italien not good enough ??

title: Small room with view of tailor shop and garage
review: My mom stay in a renovated room and it is very good, I stayed in an old one and it was not so good. Both rooms were very big (bathroom too).  Breakfast has a great variety. Just excellent. Great staff too.

title: Good Stay
review: My two nieces and I stayed at the Londra for two nights.  The room was very small, and we had a view of a tailor shop (sewing machines and materials) and someone's very cluttered garage.  There were mosquitoes in the room that bit us at night.  The hotel is by the train station, which is convenient but noisy.  The front desk was unfriendly, never offered to help with our bags or make suggestions for restaurants.  The breakfast was delicious, but the waiter wanted us to sit with another family so as to not dirty a table.  Unbelievable!

title: Perfectly located hotel
review: Stayed four nights and found the hotel to be excellent.  Asked for room at the back which was quiet apart from people above moving around late at night.  Room was very spacious and comfortable bed. Breakfast each day was one of the best with an amazing selection.  The location is very accessible particularly for train station when going to/from airport and bus station for trips to Sienna etc. Would definitely stay again.

title: Disappointing
review: We stayed as part of a tour and this hotel was a late change to our itinerary. We booked two rooms but weren't able to have adjoining, instead they were next to each other meaning an adult needed to share with a young child in each room.   The rooms we were allocated were absolutely horrendous. Not only were they nothing like their website advertised, they were filthy too. Our rooms looked like they were straight out of the late 50's. everything was beige and grubby. The safe was so tiny it could barely fit our passports let alone the tour wallet. There were large holes and cracks in the walls and black mould all over the bathroom ceiling. But worse than all this was finding long black hairs inside all four beds, both inside the sheets and also visible under the sheets. The…

title: GREAT hotel in a MARVELLOUS city!!!!
review: Stayed at this hotel as a part of a whistle stop tour of Italy, staying just one night in Florence. Expected something fairly standard as we had chosen to stay near the station for ease of travel and fitting as much in as possible in our limited time.   The good points- it is within a 5 minute walk of the station and some of the main attractions of the city. Breakfast had reasonable selection.   The bad points- uncomfortable bed and a pillow each with just one spare pillow in the room. There is poor soundproofing and therefore noises in the hallway all night lead to a restless sleep. Also a considerable amount of mould in the shower. At €180 plus city tax definitely expected better.

title: Comfortable hotel
review: It was a very pleasant, wonderful stay!!!! Had a fantastic room with my own private balcony.... view of the city and sun all day round if I wanted to stay in!!!! It was a superior deluxe room.... Furthermore the hotel was within EASY walking distance from the places of interest.... What DID displease  me, was the horrible way housekeeping looked after you.... Everything seemed to be too much for the cleaning lady and you  had indeed to ask for the things that you  wanted or that were missing.... But by enlarge, a wonderful stay in an incredible city  but for the hotel.... rating 3.... Though the bed was great and comfortable and the bathroom nice.... All bec. of housekeeping....

title: Ok
review: We stayed two nights at this comfortable hotel in Florence.  The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was equipped with the usual toiletries.  The location appeared to be remote from the areas of interest, and on one evening we strolled a fair distance to find a restaurant for our evening meal.  The breakfasts were acceptable, and on one evening we were provided with dinner as part of our travel group.  The meal was acceptable, but not outstanding.

title: Just Okay
review: I would have given this hotel a 4* rating if it had not placed me in a single room on its 6th floor. I was on a holiday with the Royal Horticultural Society to view gardens and villas in and around Florence. The holiday was organised by Brightwater Tours and I paid a £500 single supplement charge. To my shock the room was so small I could not swing a cat. The bed is a 2.5 foot wide couch in the room. The fittings in the bathroom is old. I was disappointed to find that my fellow tour mates had been allocated rooms with proper twin beds. When I complained they gave me a room with a small double bed on the second floor the next day. Just be aware that the sixth floor has yet to be renovated.    Otherwise the hotel serves delicious titbits at their bar for cocktail hours. I even…

title: Good location near Train station, clean hotel
review: Stayed here while on a tour of Italy. Room was a nice size but it wasn't the cleanest. Shower was odd in the bathroom. Beds were hard and pillows were thin. Ate in the restaurant and the food wasn't bad but nothing special.

title: Excellent hotel for a family stay very well located
review: This hotel is just 10 minutes far from train station, Santa Maria novella, clean and acceptable italian breakfast.  Wifi works good and kind staffs  Thanks all the receptionist and bell boys  Tip: is perfect if you want to just have a short stay in Florence and go on by train

title: quite a good choice
review: Very nice hotel, location is perfect for visiting florence and Toscany region next to Santa Maria Novella station. The staff is very helpful. the rooms are spacious and clean. The Breakfast is fresh with large choice. We stayed for 4 nights and we really enjoyed this hotel. We do recommend this hotel for family and business trip.

review: Nice hotel, well located and helpful staff.  Nice variety for breakfast.  Room was spacious, clean a bit dated as well as the decor.  In my experience beds are too soft, other than that, it was very good.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Located next to the SMdiN train station. Very old hotel, with old services and tools. Rooms are not correctly isolated, especially those on the tramway's road. Mattresses are super soft, which is quite unacceptable for a 4-star hotel. Decoration is old and poor. Hopefully the rooms seemed clean.  Night shift service is not very welcoming. You better avoid this place.

title: Nice days in Florence
review: Lovely Hotel, staff were very helpful & polite. We had a great room at the front of the hotel it was spacious,comfortable, spotlessly clean and had great air con which was much appreciated as it was  41 degrees outside! It is in a great location handy for the train station & all the sights.

title: Poor service, can not believe 4 stars
review: Great experience being in Italy and visiting regional cities such as Florence #Firenze .Our choice was very correct for staying at the hotel Londra due to its location,warm welcome,room with a beautiful view & amenities and surprise received a fruit basket. We have enjoyed our breakfasts too here.Thanks to Gm ,Fo,F&B and all team at the property.

review: The location is nice, not directly next to or opposite the train station, but is within easy walking distance.  Lobby is big and breakfast hall is big as well with quite big selection of cold and warm food. My only complaint for breakfast is that they served only 1 type of fresh fruit (watermelon) , others are canned fruits like peach, appricot, pineapple.    Our room is newly renovated, with a very modern and all-white trendy design which actually doesn't match the hotel, but new room is always better than tired-looking room, so we are happy about it.  My biggest problem and complaint is the mattress. I am not a person who will complain about mattress, when i read some reviews about mattress too soft or hard, i will just give it a tease.  The problem is that for the king-size…

title: Very nice hotel and close from main station
review: The staff was friendly and helpfull .. The room was clean comfi and with enough space ... the resturanat and the breakfast were amazing .... The location was 100m near the traon station ... and 10 min away from the famous sights... the room veiw was incridible ...

title: More 3 star than 4
review: We have stayed 4 nights in this hotel in family room with two children and it was very nice stay. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The location is near Firenze Santa Maria Novella and 10-15 minutes walking to main attractions in downtown Piazza della Repubblica and other attractions. They have very nice breakfast in wide and well arranged restaurant with outstanding waitresses and waiters. The hotel has parking for €20/nights. There are many stores and restaurants in the area.

title: Close to the station
review: It is a good place with great bar and breakfast area. Staff are excellent and location is great to train station.  However the rooms need a bit of updating, they are ok but not 4 star. It could be a great gem of a place and just needs some TLC

review: We stayed there one night and our stay was enjoyable. Kind and helpful staff. Parking.  Located in the railway station area. Quiet at night. Large room. Cleaned room and bathroom. Well functioning air conditioning and wifi. Large flat TV (we didn’t use it). Not so comfortable bed. Varied breakfast. Soya milk available.

title: Great staff, good food FABULOUS bathroom
review: My husband and I stayed in your hotel from 3-9 July 2017.    Due to serious baggage delay by Airline, hotel staff assisted us to receive and deliver our 2 pieces of luggages on 7 July (Fri) morning.  However, the airline and courier staff forgot to deliver our luggage key together with our luggages, I was unable to open it!  I was so upset and went to the front desk to check if there were any locksmith around the hotel or train station.    Luckily, I met Mr Daniele Fedele, after he learnt my awful experiences, he counter proposed to send an in-house technician to our room and check for us.  Finally, our luggage can be unlocked successfully by the technician with his tools!  Both my husband and I felt very thankful to Daniele and the technician, especially Daniele who went extra…

title: Nice hotel with friendly staff and good breakfast
review: We need an ADA compliant bathroom and this hotel was as good, if not better than most. The staff was multi-lingual, and very professional. Remember to ask the Staff at breakfast for espresso or cappuccino, the standard coffee at breakfast is Americano. We had dinner in the hotel on the nights we exhausted ourselves. Good was truly Italian and Staff was great. We even got to chat with others staying there. I would go back again.

title: Close to railway station but unwelcoming front desk staff
review: Hotel Londra is a smart, clean and efficient hotel which is handy for the city but not in the thick of it. We asked for a quiet room at the back of the building and this was no problem at all. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed, nice en suite, a balcony and much-needed air conditioning (it was 38 degrees outside!).  Even the corridors were cooled which was an unexpected bonus. The breakfast was varied, including pastries, bread/toast, fruit, cereal, bacon and eggs, marinated cannellini beans (very tasty), fresh tomatoes, cooked ham, cheese, jams etc etc. I told the staff I was vegan and they were very happy to make me coffee/tea with soya milk, and pointed out which breakfast items were vegan. It takes about 10-15 minutes to get to Piazza Santa Maria Novella,…

title: Mr Tom Chan
review: We spent two nights there.  There's a very pleasant restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.  The food was very good.  We had breakfast(2) and dinner (1) there.  The bar was enjoyable as well with good snacks and reasonably priced drinks.

title: A very good hotel
review: My wife and I have been coming to this hotel, Hotel Londra in Florence, Italy for nearly 10 years for both business and leisure. The hotel staff are always friendly and helpful. Last year, I lost a Burberry belt in the trip, Hotel Londra responded to my email instantly and professionaly but the other Hotel we also stayed in our trip did not even respond to us at all. This year we have some problems in getting on some particular websites. The staff were very helpful and sincerely working their best to find out solutions to solve my problems. Finally the Manager, Mr Taddei came out to perspnally resolve my problem. I was very impressed by their professional services to their hotel guests. The hotel has very good quality food too, nice atmosphere, very good services. And if you…

title: Good hotel
review: The accommodation in this Florence hotel was very pleasant. The large and clean room, the fully equipped and clean bathroom, the excellent breakfast and the in-house parking provide a sense of security for those who travel by car.

title: Extremely clean, larger rooms than expected!
review: Its a nice hotel situated near railway station...rooms are spacious...washroom is also spacious and good..breakfast menu was also vast...its more modern than other hotels of italy which are quite of an old touch

review: We had a marvelous stay in Florence  at the Londra Hotel. Wonderful interiors, very good service and some excellent dining too, must recommend the hotel's restaurant for Breakfast, and other Italian delicious  dishes. Very reasonably priced too for a luxury hotel. Excellent service and hospitality.

title: Quite a mix of experiences
review: Very close to the Firenze station. The hotel is nice and has a great bar. Upon Check-in, Emanuela was professional and accommodating. The first room we were assigned to the beds were uncomfortable. However, we were easily accommodated to a more comfortable room. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Londra.

title: Great hotel, very good services
review: Part of an insights tour hotel package. In our group we had multiple flavors  of rooms- some ultramodern and rehabbed- some that time has forgotten. My room 628 was one that was forgotten, circa 1980. The air conditioning did not work, the hair dryer had no power and was difficult to dry your hair. Two attempts to tell the desk our air did not work, yielded no response.  Others had much better experiences. The hotel is not centrally located and a street fight was easily heard at 4 am from our room.  Ask to see your room before you unpack.

title: Great Breakfasts
review: Not so close to attractions, but near enough to walk to them.  Clean, beautifully decorated, a very good breakfast, and people very well trained to receive guests. Offers parking service if you've rented a car. I hardly recommend it.

title: Reasonable hotel.
review: This hotel was within walking distance of the main train station and central Florence. It has secure parking. The breakfast was nice. We enjoyed our stay. The staff was great. Plenty of restaurants in the area.

title: True 4 Star
review: The hotel is old, but refurbished with some modern components. AC system runs only during the day and shuts off at 9pm until after mid May.  The hotel provides a plug in mosquito repellent gizmo so we can open the swing window to keep the room cool overnight.  However, that lets in traffic noise since the light rail transit line runs on street outside of window. We were in room 605.  The bathroom has a bathtub with shower head but only a narrow piece of glass to keep the spray contained.  The toilet is located behind the bathroom door - if only the plumber had swapped positions with the bidet.  There is a water kettle in the room.  Almost all the rooms that we've stayed at in italy has type 'L' electrical sockets.  Type 'L' are three pins in a row and are compatible with types…

title: Near to the station
review: Comfortable and well equipped.  Breakfast spread was good, more than enough with fresh brewed coffee.  5-min walk to Santa Maria Station, yet not noisy.   Moving bulky luggage to and fro hotel and station is possible but needs more time and energy.  Convenient location as most day tours meeting point at Santa Maria Station.

title: Station proximity hotel
review: The hotel is very convenient for the main station.  Although an older building, the interior is modern in style.  The restaurant was spacious with a good choice at breakfast.  Although the curtain-pulls needed repair, my room was quite satisfactory, and quiet being at the back, but the bathroom was a problem.  A large range of fittings, including a bidet, had been squeezed into a very small space.  The shower was tiny with little room to move.

title: Hot and noisy
review: We stayed here for 3 nights location was great near to the Center and the station.  We checked in and was given a room on the 6th floor. I opened the door looked at my partner and we walked back out in shock at how horrendous it was! The smell was pungent it was so humid and dusty cabinets were broken the bed was solid and had a thin mattress it was so terrible. The pictures on the website are deceiving we was stuck with a old room when there advertising new rooms that are modernised.   Needles to say we complained and was moved to room 416 it was like we had been transported to a new hotel! The hallways were better room was spacious modern white with balconies, clean bathrooms!   I urge anyone staying there to ask reception to change it can be done.  The breakfast was also…

title: Great location once you get your bearings.
review: Clean hotel which is in a great location. Rooms are large but quirky, which space pod furniture.  Very noisy though as a tram line is right outside the hotel and no other way to regulate the temperature other than open the window

title: Great location, a bit noisy
review: Checking in was painless. The staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. The street outside the hotel was busy but once you got familiar with the trains and the surrounding areas it worked well for us.

title: Ideally located Hotel
review: the Hotel Londra is ideally situated 200 meters from the train station.  Additionally, it is within walking distance of virtually all of the "need to see" sites in the city. The room was very comfortable with a nice balcony overlooking parts of the city.  The buffet breakfast was reasonable with American and European choices.  The only concern we had was with the noise late in the evening.  Numerous groups were staying at the hotel during our stay.  They were especially loud after midnight.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

title: Nice place for a quick stopover
review: But not more and not if you're a tourist. The area is not very nice, the room was super small for the price but mostly the staff are not friendly. I had to find somewhere private after we checked out for maternity purposes so I asked the lady at the check-in desk. She coldly recommended the smoking room. I tried to go there but as expected it smelled heavily of smoke. The purpose of our visit was to attend a conference on nicotine and tobacco so I wasn't going to step in there. I ended up going to the cold terasse/garden for some time.

title: Easy walking distance to the station
review: Stayed here for 2 nights in August. Close proximity to the train/bus terminal which was a plus. It was about 20-35 mins walk from most of the attractions. The statue of David being the furthest away.  The hotel was recently renovated so we got a really nice modern looking room with a Queen size bed and a balcony. Everything was nice in the room during our stay.  Breakfast was included and was buffet style with a good variety of options.

title: Hotel Londra
review: Not where I'd choose to spend a long time in Florence but perfect for overnight/short stay when you need to be close to the station. Rooms are okay for the price. There are loads of options at breakfast and free wi fi throughout is a bonus.

title: Modern Hotel, everything cool
review: Stayed here a couple of times and loved the closeness to the Rail and sites, breakfast just great and champagne  for breakfast is a must.   Staff are really good and friendly, rooms are clean and well maintained. Happy to recommend .

Finally after calling the desk again, about 5 minutes later, personnel was sent to this room to escort me a room like the one I originally booked and like the ones…

title: Not quite bad enough for 3 stars,  but its no 4 hotel either.
review: Lovely hotel we stayed in a superior room was was quite large with a great bathroom. Very clean and the bed was so comfortable. Buffett breakfast had plenty to choice from great service & friendly staff.

title: Londra Hotel
review: We stayed 1 night as part of an Insight "Highlights of Europe" tour. The hotel was very nice; the bar and restaurant were very good and our room was relatively large for Europe. Fortunately, we had a quiet room on the side so we didn't have to contend with the noisy street front (as reported by other tour members)

title: I didn't love this hotel
review: Came from Rome to Florence on Oct 20th to stay at the Hotel Londra,the weather was cool at night but warm during the day.As the many years I have travel there has  never been a hotel that did not or would not turn the air conditioner on???I was told because it was cool at night that they could not turn the air on,you can leave the window open.Location is noisy when you have leave windows or doors open. The problem with that My balcony was open to the balcony in the room next to me. I did not like have my room open all the time.

title: Noisy place in the center of the city
review: I love to travel, and I'm not one to complain because... you know... travel is amazing. But Londra in Florence was not an enjoyable stay and in my opinion, not a four star property. The rooms weren't clean (mold in the bathrooms), the beds were uncomfortable, the restaurant food was pretty terrible. I did not enjoy my two night stay there. That said, it is good walking distance to shopping and sites (or a very short cab ride), and the staff were very lovely. Adequate yes, but I would not stay there again.

title: Disappointing Hotel
review: I stayed in this hotel for one business week. The majority of the meeting room are in the basement without windows and the private rooms are very noisy. Furthermore the reception desk organisation is not really efficient, you must wait a while every time you have an inquiry. The overall evaluation is poor for business travelers. It is probably the perfect choice for American old tourists, due to the location and the breakfast food selection (i.e. pancake)

title: Great location, comfortable
review: My wife and I stayed here for a 3 night visit to Firenze. The Hotel is located within walking distance of the main sites and is clean, tidy and well equipped.  The rooms are quirky but modern and comfortable.  The venue is reasonably priced and I would recommend a stay here.

title: A little disappointed
review: We stayed for 2 nights. Our room had 2 single beds, they were very comfortable however the pillows were a bit flat. The room was very spacious and clean. Our room was right next to the road and railway tracks which I thought would pose a noise problem but with the double glazed windows, there was hardly any noise. 5 minute walk to the train station and 10-15 mins into city center. Breakfast was very good. I have to agree with some reviews the receptionist gave us our keys and that was it. She didn't tell us what floor our room was on or where the restaurant was (she was a trainee as she was getting direction from another but both failed to tell us what floor we were on) it wasn't a big deal really but that is the business - accommodating. Overall it's a great location.

title: Very disappointing.
review: We booked Hotel Londra  primarily for its location as we had booked two early morning tours and pick up was at the train station. It is a 5 mins walk to the station, and 10/15 into the centre of Florence. The hotel is clean,  lobby is bright, a classic style with a bar , bedrooms are minimalistic style. We all thought breakfast buffet was very good and both breakfast staff and bar staff were very helpful.  Our only gripe was that we felt that through out our stay the reception staff did not engage with us, weren't particularly helpful and were a bit surly. All four of remarked that when we were checking out and paying our bill that we were never asked had we enjoyed our stay or how was everything at the hotel. It was a case of pay and go. For this reason we gave 3 star rating.

title: Perfect for our 2 nights stay in florence
review: He hotel itself is clean, modern and inviting but for at three day business trip was not a comfortable place to be staying in. My room was clean but the double bed I was offered was two singles pushed together with mattresses that I actually thought was a plank with foam. Actually removed sheets to look. The bed was as hard as rock, uncomfortable and the well used flat pillows made for an uncomfortable night. Not mentioning the two short curtains that can't be closed. Luckily I had a safety pin to pull these together for, at least some darkness for the morning sunrise.   Breakfast was satisfactory but only 5 tables for two guests. I sat at a table for 8, on my own as did a number of other couples while bigger groups had to wait. Not managed well by the staff.  They offered high…

title: Friendly and comfortable in the heart of Florence
review: My wife and i stayed at hotel londra while in Florence, nice little place walking distance to the heart of Florence, staff were very friendly rooms were clean, nice buffet breakfast, staff recommend a few nice restaurants for dinner, (that were pretty good) gave us tips places to see & what to do with our time, would definitely stay there again.

title: Perfect for tourists.
review: I stayed here for 8 days and soon got to know the staff and the waiters, as they also got to know me.  Very friendly staff in all departments.   My room was comfortable although the view from the balcony was the back of the hotel - when the sun shone I could see the hills of Tuscany in the distance.  The restaurant was very pleasant - breakfast was an extensive buffet - point to remember, if you want real coffee at breakfast you need to ask, other wise its simply black coffee from an urn.   The restaurant for lunch and dinner was very good with some very well cooked and presented meals.  Its worth going into the bar before dinner since there is a range of small appetisers free for your enjoyment.  A step up from the usual nuts and crisps.

title: Best stay ever!
review: We stayed in this hotel from August 6 to August 9, 2016. It was a leisure trip. Hotel is located just 10 minutes walk from SMN Train station. Tourist buses for other destinations like Pisa, Siena and Chianti operates within the walking distance from this hotel. They have beautiful bar with garden seating area. You can find everything in your room that is required by an average traveller. They provide morning breakfast with Limited options for vegetarians. I will recommend this place.

title: Great location, tricky to get to
review: I booked this hotel through booking and having never visited Florence before, I had my doubts. This was by far the best hotel in all our trip! (Being also in Rome and Venice) The location is great - walking distance from the train station, but on the side street, so it's not noisy at all.  Hotel is brand new renovated, and someone did a great job thinking about every little detail. We are family of four and took one room that was suggested by the booking.com. The room was very spacious and we had enough place for all of us. Bathroom is a dream! We had both the shower and jacuzzi bathtub. Little patio downstairs is very cosy if you want to have a late night drink and enjoy the smoking.  Breakfast was ok to keep us full till late lunch. All in all - highly recommended!!! Ps. We…

title: Great location, classic hotel, tough to park
review: We really liked Hotel Londra! I wasn't 100% sure about this one when I booked it but we stayed on the 4th floor, our room didn't have much of a view but has been modernised and was great. Breakfast was included and there was a decent range to choose from on the buffet. The bar was fantastic with nibbles out every evening. The gentleman that runs the restaurant (I unfortunately didn't catch his name) was great and made dining an enjoyable experience, the food was good and well priced. The location is good, right near the train station and a short walk to everything in Florence. The hotel wi-fi was good but could be quicker if you're using Netflix (we could only find one English Channel on TV. However it was good streaming YouTube and Netflix on a lower quality. The Fitness centre…

title: Thought i have arrived at the wrong hotel compared to the website!
review: Centrally located next to the Main Train Station. The hotel is excellent and great breakfast. Has a tiny gym. Hotel offers expensive parking, but you dont have much choice.  The area around it is a bit boring with scarce shopping. You'd have to drive or ride to the sights.

title: Ideally situated Hotel
review: Just returned from a business trip, the hotel was booked for me and look fine on the website. I was alone travelling and the website boasted that they catered for lone woman travellers, with free upgrade and room service. None of this was mentioned when checking in and I even had to ask where breakfast was and the timings. The room was beyond basic, very tired! The bathroom was desperate for a refit, there were cracked tiles on the floor and the shower cubical left a lot to be desired. The hotel walls are paper thin and it was extremely noisy. Last night I hardly had any sleep as there was a very large party of teenagers that were running about the hotel very loudly from room to room. I called reception several times to complain as it was 3.20am and was told they knew about it…

title: Amazing Stay in Florence!!!
review: We stayed here in July with friends from Australia.   The rooms were very clean and well decorated. The staff polite and professional but the bar staff were a little hard to find at times!  The hotel was close to the main train station and not too far to walk to the main attractions.   Breakfast is buffet style, with a good range of options.

The room we were in had a wonderful view.   Breakfast was included and was okay. It was a buffet that included many options.  The only criticism I have is that the walls are thin and we could hear people in the room beside us speaking.   The staff was friendly and spoke English.

title: Great Location
review: Unfortunately I have to agree with some previous reviews. Really quite abrupt reception staff (in general), and some, actually quite rude. This unfortunately detracts from some of the very nice staff including those in the bar and breakfast areas.  I had room 116. Extremely noisy room and decor tired. The bathroom needed grouting and generally needed updating. The website pictures certainly didn't reflect the room I had. I could hear flushing of toilets and running water/showers from all angles and consistently awoken at circa 6am and not able to sleep longer due to ongoing noise. Again, like other reviews, I was able to hear adjoining room guests bodily actions in their bathrooms which is not pleasant.  There was an adjoining door to another room....at points, during the early…

title: Nice play to stay
review: Londra is just a 5 minute walk from the train station making it very convenient .The staff is courteous and the hotel is always buzzing with activity as it caters to big groups like Cosmos etc. The breakfast is good and rooms are decent size The reception is kind enough to call for a taxi to save you from the walk to the station curb where you can find a taxi

title: Disappointed
review: Recently renovated room - good size with all needed amenities. Excellent buffet breakfast. Our room faced onto a fairly busy street with trams and was noisy at times. Situated close to the City (about 10-15 minute walk). Overall a nice play to stay.

review: Visited this place for 5 nights for a city break! Lovely hotel! Perfect location!, food was lovely! Amazing lasagne in the hotel!, bar had some lovely drinks! Lots of men working in hotel, and as a women felt like being stared at a lot by the Italian workers, felt uncomfortable at times!, but apart from that rooms were lovely! Balconies and air conditioning was lovely! Would Probably return!

title: LOVED THIS HOTEL!
review: Great hotel - very good prices - breakfast was perfect - clean rooms.  Only odd thing is a few sets of stairs in the corridor on our floor so made lugging the luggage awkward but for the price, location and value a fantastic stay.

title: Great Location but Needs Updating
review: My sister and I stumbled upon Hotel Londra after 2 nights in a B&B with very loud traffic noise & 3 flights of narrow stairs.The hotel staff at Londra treated us so well! The room and adjoining bath was spacious, quiet, and luxurious. The hotel's restaurant was elegant, & the breakfast (included) was unbelievable! Londra also has a happy hour with delicious food included. Lastly, the hotel's location is right around the corner from the train station, and their policy allows patrons to store luggage safely during the day of departure. Hotel Londra made our Firenze visit a high point of our entire trip!

title: Hot! Hot! Hot!
review: We spent 2 nights here while visiting Florence.  The location is perfect and within walking distance of all major sites, shopping, and restaurants.  BUT, it is really really in need of updating - bathroom tile was chipped and old - still had old fashioned 'keys' for the room doors that you were asked to leave at the front desk every time you left the hotel.  Air conditioning was non existent - we had a control in our room, but it was so very hot every night! Windows did open, but street noise made it impossible to sleep, so we closed the windows and sweltered.  The  wifi was free, but very slow and unreliable.  I would pick a different hotel on my next stay.

review: Located near the train station and shops Everything was perfect. From the location to the staff. The rooms were nice, clean and modern.  Free Wifi access. Parking was a big plus. The breakfast was very nice too. We'll stay there again with pleasure.

title: Great location
review: We found this hotel a delight , the staff were helpful the reception was lovely and the food at breakfast plentiful . The room was a good size and very clean , comfortable with good stocked mini bar , tea / coffee making facilities and English channels on the TV. It is a 5 to 8 min walk to the main railway station which is just across the road from the Duma cathedral and a good area of shops. We would stay here again and recommend it whole heartily .

title: Excellent Hotel and near train station and bus that leaves for Pisa Airport
review: This hotel is old and rustic. It's unlike a lot of the modern hotels. They still use physical actual keys for the rooms and the in room safe.   The staff are friendly and helpful. There are restaurants around which are near the train station.   At the train station, there's a supermarket which you can buy water or snacks from. There's also a pharmacy in the train station itself.

title: Disappointing hotel
review: The staff changed my room when I requested a bathtub...next time I'll request a room with a bathtub online...the staff was professional and friendly..the bathroom I thought could have had more light. I would have liked to have a light directly over the bathroom mirror which is usually standard. Breakfast which was included was exceptional and well presented in buffet style. I highly recommended this hotel with the request for a light over the mirror. Maybe other rooms have one.

title: It was okay
review: A central location, a nice and clean hotel and modern enough. At dinner you have a planty of choices of food and in the morning the breakfast is tipical italian, so good food. The hosts are well prepaired and friendly; they can help you with everything you need and they even give you nice hits for visits and so on. Not far away from this location you can find a very nice restaurant, its called "L'Osteria di Giovanni". Enjoy.

title: Valentines
review: The room was rather small but we had what we needed. Unfortunately, the draperies in our room did not close all the way so we had light coming in all night. People with sensitivities to light should use a sleeping mask or get another room. Also, the room did not have carpet so you may want to have your own slippers to keep your feet warm on the floor. The bathroom was a bit of a squeeze but it had everything that a person would need. I would stay again if I had to.

title: Ok Hotel
review: 6 day stay. very convenient for station. Superior room clean linen and towels fresh and good options at breakfast. Staff also helpful with suggestions and easily conversed in English. Too much to do so did not eat in restaurent but menu looked good. Bar offered full range of drinks through coffee to cocktails. Good 4 star hotel.

title: Absolut OK...
review: We stayed here as part of a tour group.  Our room overlooked the train tracks but the triple glazing kept out most of the noise.  The room was a reasonable size and clean.  You can walk to the centre of town, restaurants, shops etc.

Service friendly but discreet. ideal for visiting Florence, don't need more

title: Great Hotel in Florence
review: Rooms are bit small in size , specially bath tub and bathing area. For tall and healthy person taking shower will be a good exercise. Room is not good ventilated. Food is good and specially bar is having good collection

title: Good hotel maybe not in winter
review: Excellent position just 5 minutes walk from train station and 10 minutes walk from main shops and attractions. The desk staff were friendly and very helpful, the rooms were modern,comfortable and clean. We loved the extra speed wifi and the super breakfast buffet full of Italian and international specialties! Great hotel, I would highly recommend it!

title: Great hotel, nice staff.
review: The hotel is near the railway station and very close to Fortezza , there fore  5 stars for the location   The staff is super friendly  very helpful 5 stars for that   The rooms are super small , even that I'm not a big person , but the rooms are quite small  And the temperature in the room was too cold  for end January .  The air on didn't work properly so it was decently too cold .  2 stars for that   Breakfast was ok but not what I'm used from a Italian hotel .  3 stars here for   What totally love is your veggie soap !  Amazing stuff   In total I recommend The Londra but I think I would try other hotels as well .

review: The hotel was not bad but the staff were reluctant to help when we asked for an extra pillow the women became a bit rude.The room was very basic with  Very uncomfortable beds.good location to trains and main square.

title: Least Favourite Hotel on Our Recent Trip to Italy
review: I stayed at this hotel for a 3 day conference in December '15. The staff were friendly, the food was lovely, the conference facilities were excellent and the rooms were clean and purposeful with a modern feel, though perhaps a little basic. ~5 minutes walk from train station and ~10 minutes walk from main shops/attractions. Recommended.

title: Great Hotel, Good Rooms !
review: First the good points:  We were on the sixth (Top) floor and we has a nice balcony over looking Florence.  The breakfast buffet was OK but not great. Now the bad points.  We were traveling with a group and we all had rooms that were not clean.  Our toilet was dirty (urine stains on the seat) when we arrived and the carpet could have used a good vacuuming. Many people in our group had a balcony but no door like our room so they had to crawl out the window to use it.  The furniture and beds were tired.  The striped couch and bedspreads made me think I was in prison.  The staff on the front desk were not friendly or helpful and did nothing about our complaints about the room's cleanliness.  I am usually not to hard to please but I don expect a clean room and this hotel was a…

title: Almost 5
review: Stayed here with our tour group in October 2015, check in was very fast for 40 people, the rooms are of good size and very clean. the beds are comfortable. The desk people are very professional and quite friendly. This is a very nice hotel and we would stay here again. We recommend this hotel highly.

review: propoery is good but the room i got is not good view is there i can only see some house apartments near to station but by taxi you have to take a long run as its one way road. SO in this amount can get something much better.

title: Good location
review: We arrived at the Londra which is really close to the train station (walking distance) and it looked pleasant and clean. The rooms are very odd. They are supposed to be ultra modern, I guess. The television was set inside a mirror in both the living area and the bathroom. The square toilets, while perfectly function, could not have been more uncomfortable. We were supposed to have a king sized bed and it was two double beds pushed together. The shower was awful to operate too. If you don't want to wash your hair, you need to either wear a shower cap or dodge the water quickly! We were on the front of the building and could hear the tram until 2AM. The breakfast buffet was nice enough. I would not bother staying here again, but if you don't care what the hotel is and want a…

title: Deceiving Lobby
review: Good location very close to train station. At first we were worried about the railway noises but it was not bothered us. Good breakfast. Clean. But most of the receptionists are very impatient. Very good quality with the accessories for bathroom.

title: Great location and terrific amenities!
review: The lobby to this hotel is extremely nice and it would lead you to believe that the rooms are nice as well...such is not the case. The rooms are SUPER OLD. Our first room smelled so much like smoke that we had to be moved to another room. The carpet was a weird burgundy color.

title: Nice hotel within walking distance to everything in Florence.
review: Initially a little quirky with real brass keys to rooms and room safes.  Check-in was quick and efficient and real keys were issued.  It was great to find a hotel at last that recognises that couples tend to travel with two cases and not one.  There were two rack-spaces for cases.  Our room was clean and well presented.  We also had a spacious balcony overlooking the street.  Our room was separated from the balcony by double glazed doors that shielded the room from any street noise.  Lobby areas, dining spaces and the bar were well presented.  Breakfast (included) represented effort but was marred by stale bread and croissants.  In-room WiFi worked well.  This is a good solid hotel.

title: Comfortable stay
review: We wanted a hotel close to the train station to make day trips easy.  This hotel was perfect for that, plus easy to walk everywhere in Florence.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, even keeping our big bags overnight while we spent one night in the Cinque Terre region.  The restaurant was convenient and good quality.  It is on a quiet street, a little dark walking home at night but we had no probles.

title: Good Hotel Handy Location
review: Built in the 60's and about 200m away from the railway station Santa Maria Novella, the hotel is just 7 minutes walk from the railway station.  However, it is located in the opposite direction of the city center (about 30 to 40 minutes walk or 10 minutes ride by tram).  The street looks deserted after dark and may not be good for walking after dark.  There are many restaurants and shops around the railway station.  The hotel is rated 4 star, rooms are renovated, have high ceilings, individually controlled air conditioning, and provided with complimentary wi-fi.  The entrance and lobby have a modern look.  The rooms are clean and spacious with hard wood flooring and have 32 inch TVs, mini fridges, in room mini safes and hair driers.  I was a bit surprised to find an in room…

title: Great Location
review: For the tourist this is a great hotel short walking distance to all the attractions and when the day is over there are plenty restaurants nearby. The hotel is old, rooms are not great but are comfortable. We had one dinner at the hotel which was nice also the included breakfast was of a high standard. Staff are friendly. This is not the best hotel in the world but one comes to see the attractions and this alone is why one should stay here.

title: Disappointed
review: We stay were for 3 nights. THE hotel is good,and relative close to the center.The rooms are big and clean.The bed was good,with large beds.In the room we have coffe .The a Only thing that i dont like was the closed.Was open and anyone can see your clothes.The bathroom was nicely and good size.The breakfast was good but a bit repetative.The personal was very helpful. The hotel also have a parking but it cost 20E/day.

title: Good hotel with excellent location
review: I read a lot of good reviews about this hotel so I expected better. I've been to Florence before and would have stayed at the previous hotel but this was part of a package. The hotel is not in a good location. It's to the side of the train station down a long empty street that's unsavory at night. That staff was okay but not overly hospitable. The halls smell musty and as if someone's been smoking despite the no smoking signs. The room is a nice size but no thrills. There was only one plug for our phones. The light switches are bizarre and turn on lights in the opposite are that its in. We'll see how breakfast goes in the morning..

title: Average hotel in average location
review: Stayed on 17 th August for four days, excellent location near Santa Maria novella station, hence very convenient, walking distance from duomo, etc.  excellent service, nice rooms. Breakfast is also alright.  Good value for money hotel

title: Clean hotel close to the train station
review: We stayed at hotel Londra as part of a tour. In terms of our room it was adequate, renovated and well appointed, the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was nicely appointed and overall a good sized room. We had a room on first floor just above the front entrance. Our room had doors out to a large deck that would have been fabulous if there was actually some decent furniture to relax on, it just had one grotty table and chair. The view was not exactly inviting.  What let the hotel down for us was the location. While it wasn't too far to walk to the main attractions in central Florence the location felt just somewhat unsafe compared to other hotels we had stayed in during our tour, the location also had no character at all. There were also some rather unsavoury characters that…
