title: Basic city center hotel. Walking distance to attractions and very close to train station
review: Our intention was to stay at this hotel for two nights. There are several reasons why we stayed for only one night:  - insects (meaning many) in the room ceiling. We took pictures and explained this to the reception. Normally, in this kind of situation someone might apologize. We were told "we can have another room if we want".   - this another room seemed not to have any isolation regarding external or internal noice. We could hear everything (and I mean everything) from the other rooms, including people using toilet, talking to each other etc. We also heard every single person of a bigger group leaving at very early hours in the morning, not to mention a party which was ongoing in one of the rooms.   - we had agreed with the reception on the first evening that we would stay…

title: Beautiful
review: Basic city center hotel. Walking distance to attractions and very close to train station.  Hosts a lot of tourist groups in buses, so can get crowded in the lobby at peak times.  Breakfast was fresh, plentiful, tasty.  Service was efficient but not over the top. Some rooms are re-furbished and some are not.  The ones that are not are in a 70s style.  Not modern at all, but clean and AC works.  The new ones have a very modern and "cool white" look to them.  Rooms are not very large. Wifi was free but very slow and I was unable to do work.

title: Great hotel
review: It was a Warm welcome at the Front Office. The elderly male receptionist gave me a warm Italian welcome. Made me feel good about coming to Florence for my vacation.  The Hotel is beautiful; from the main entrance which is the reception to the rooms upstairs. It's beautiful & very clean. Hotel is a very central location. Not far from the train terminal. Easy access to anywhere in Florence. Though the tram rail is right behind the hotel, the soundproofing of the hotel is so good you won't know there's a tram rail behind. The room is large enough. Very roomy. The bathroom is cute! All amenities are beautiful! For a 3 star hotel, it surpassed my imagination! Breakfast is typical though. Bare & basic; croissants, eggs, sausage, cereal, cappuccino, Italian coffee, fresh fruits.  I…

title: Hotel located close to the train station, good for short stay
review: We ended up here because the original hotel we'd booked had overbooked themselves.  Things turned out OK because this was a good hotel--clean, beautiful decor, friendly staff.  This place is located an easy 5 minute walk from the train station (Santa Maria Novella).  The old town is another easy walk from there.  My room even had a small balcony, though it just overlooked the parking area.  Breakfast in the morning was great--lots of variety, good quality food.  Staff was very friendly; if you check out in the morning but travel later in the day, you can leave your luggage and collect it later.

title: Lovely visit at hotel londra
review: I got off to a good start. My room was available at 10:00, and it was an easy walk from the train station. The room felt as if it had been designed by Apple! It was quite cool (37 degrees outside) and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom similarly designed (W.C. was square!). As in so many hotels the basin did not hold water. The phone didn't work, which meant I had to go down to the front desk if I wanted laundry collected etc. I had to complain three times before a maintenance man was sent up. The air con was a bit noisy but at least it worked well.  Breakfast was not a strong point. If you wanted a fried egg, you could order it, at an extra cost of 6 euros. The list menu/price card on the table even said that tomato juice would be 4 euros! There were no fresh slices of melon or…

title: nice place
review: We stayed in this hotel July 2015 for 3 nights. The rooms was spacious, neat and clean and very modern. They can maybe put a extractor fan in the bathroom and offer some more english channels on the tv. Wifi was good and working all the time- we could not facetime or skype though. Breakfast was stunning. Good location close to Maria novella train station. Highly recommended!

title: Great hotel in Florence
review: I am staying at this hotel.  The rooms are nice and clean and a good size.  Breakfast is included and is a very nice variety.  The train station is close as are many things.  The staff is helpful here.  Good value for your money.  I would stay here again.

title: Cosmopolitan Hotel 15 Minutes Walk to the Florence city center
review: We stayed here for two nights in MAY 2015. We had a room on the end / corner which was spacious with a walk in closet and great bathroom with a lighted make up mirror. This is the only hotel of 5 we were in in Italy, that had in-room coffee and tea service which was nice.  The bed was comfy, room was clean. The breakfast and dinner at the hotel was very nice as well. I would recommend this hotel to others.

review: This was a last minute booking through Booking.com but we were not disappointed. 5 minutes walk from the station and only 10 minutes walk from many of the other attractions.   God sized room. Nice en suite. Fast wifi. Breakfast was self service but had an lots of choice. Reception staff very helpful and efficient. Would use this hotel again

title: Funky room decor
review: The location is good, clean rooms and the staff helpful. Also, the breakfast was good. We stayed in a street facing room, the train is not disturbed. The car park was a courtyard and travel to Mugello was short. Within walking distance you will find lots of good restaurants.

title: Quiet Convenient and Enjoyable
review: Convenient to train station just 200 yards away, and easy walk to Florence busheling city center.  Rooms were very clean, very unique décor, with comfortable bed, although no closets.  We has a room with a balcony facing the front which was great, especially at night.  all in all I would recommend this hotel

title: Conveniently located
review: We enjoyed staying here. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was one of the few places that we stayed in Italy that had tea and coffee making facilities. The wifi was excellent. Breakfast was very good. It is close to the train station and within walking distance of all the major attractions. Overall a very pleasant stay

review: This hotel is very conveniently located from the train station and within walking distance of many of the beautiful Florence attractions. I felt very safe walking  to and from the Hotel. The room was small but the high ceilings made it feel more spacious. The balcony was a nice to have but if you are sensitive to train noise you might want to ask for a room at the back because trains are going at all hours. The room was clean but a little tired. The cleaning staff were good. I thought the A/C was not working in the room and they sent a person right away to check it. The breakfast was also good with the usual cereal, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs bacon and hot dogs (?) fresh fruit, pastries and yogurt, I loved the fresh ricotta cheese. The only downside to this hotel is the…

title: Hotel Linda in Florence Italy
review: The hotel was a mere 5 minute walk from the SMN Central Station in Florence. And within vicinity of most tourist attractions. Situated in a quiet area, you'd feel safe specially as a solo traveller. The room was clean and tidied everyday. The bathroom and shower area a bit too small. It provided tea service and a mini bar. Breakfast was a good spread of continental options. The staff could be friendlier though and could make more effort to smile to guests and warmly accommodate their needs.

title: Nice hotel
review: We took an 18 day tour and out of all the hotels we stayed at this was the worst.  Hot, dirty,  musty,  not  friendly or  helpful. Rooms were awful. They did not want to really help until my tour director got involved

title: Very nice hotel within walking distance of the train station and main part of Florence.
review: This is my 2nd time staying in these hotel. It is very near train station and surrounded by many café and bars. Free Wifi and Breakfast. Room was big and clean. The down side is it is a bit old, the bed was too soft.

The breakfast had a nice selection. Our room was clean ans spacious,  the wi-fi signal was nice and strong. The only negative was that the room was not very sound proof, we unfortunately had a very noisy upstairs neighbour.

title: Great One Night Stay
review: Firenze is a wonderful place to be at, to see ,to admire and to walk around. To be honest it's more beautiful and i prefer it more rather than Rome.It has a lot of green ,more quiet and a lot of wonderful places around where you can stay and admire the sun, the freedom while having your vacations . During my stay there i was suggested the Londra hotel and  i did the best choice for me. Excellent and friendly service ,very welcomed.The room was super clean and comfortable, free wi-fi ,a very good breakfast and all included in a logical price of view. My staying there made me feel like a very important personality in an Elite place. Definitely recommended !!!!!!!!!!!

title: Trendy rooms in a good business hotel
review: We only stayed for one night, but we enjoyed out experience.  The rooms were comfortable and modern and major attractions were relatively close (a long walk away, but it was very doable).  Definitely worth the price!

title: Decent Hotel
review: Hotel Londra is a good business hotel in an acceptable walking distance from the Florence main train station. It is on a fairly quiet street. Although this 4 star hotel is quite ordinary and comfortable for a business visit, the room and bathroom were very modern and furnished with trendy facilities. The breakfast buffet was good.

review: I always stay at the Londra when I am in Florence. They are two blocks from the Santa Maria novella railway station. They offer a 4 star hotel service convenient to the leather market and lots of restaurants.  Their breakfast is one of the best I have found. The staff is accommodating. The rooms are modern an clean. My stay this time met all my expectations.

title: Very good hotel near the center
review: Arrived Florence S.M.N. Station way past 8pm but reached hotel easily within minutes of walking. Rooms clean and comfortable but a bit warm. street noise could be heard at night since we had to open windows for cool air to seep in.  Breakfast buffet had a wide variety and was very filling. Good restaurants, grocery, shops and city centre within walking distance. Bus to outlet mall conveniently nearby! Train station so accessible that we were able to visit Pisa without a hitch. Stayed here 3 nights and would not mind returning for next visit.

title: Modern, clean, very nice hotel
review: This was a very good hotel in a strategic point: close to the center, to the train station, to the new maggio musicale theater, and accessible by car. We have had a family room at the 6th floor that was very big and had a nice view at the city. Service was very good, the breakfast was great (except of the croissins), the staff very friendly.I reccomend it!

title: Perfect loaction and service !!
review: We had a very nice 3 night stay. The room was lovely, big, clean, quiet, modern, everything we would want. The staff were all friendly, welcoming and helpful.  The location is great, about 10 minutes walk to the centre of the city, very close to the train station with plenty of very good restaurants close by. There is parking on site at the rear of the hotel for an extra daily fee. It felt like a very peaceful place, away from the crowds of the city centre. We enjoyed after dinner drinks at the bar and sat out on the terrace.  The breakfast buffet was very good, with a wide selection. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and would choose to stay here again next time we're in town.

title: Hotel Londra, Florence - not a good experience
review: Living in a rural area in the province of Florence, me and my wife sometimes manage to leave the kids with their granny and spend the evening and the night in the city. That is how we got to Hotel Londra on a Saturday night, taking advantage of a very nice online offer. We had already tested their sister property in Milan and can confirm the same very good opinion. Large room, modern furniture, very good selection at breakfast, own parking facility at reasonable price, very close to all main attractions, friendly and efficient staff. Really very good value for money.

title: It depends on the room you get...
review: Our room was pleasant--except for the bed, which was horribly uncomfortable. We discovered that it was a hard, thin mattress on top of a board (yes, an actual wooden board). Needless to say, we did not rest well for the two nights we were there.  Then I injured my foot on the hallway steps (and had to go to the hospital for treatment) and the man at the hotel reception desk was most unkind and acted like I had inconvenienced him.  He was quite disdainful. The hallway steps are carpeted with a horizontal stripe, and they are truly an optical illusion - and there is no handrail to hold onto, so I missed the last step.    The food was good though, and the room service gentleman who brought me food when I returned from my visit to the hospital was very kind.

title: Located close to Railroad and walking distance to many sites
review: First of all, it is very clean.  The hotel is used by lots of tour groups because it is near to the old city and transportation;  railroad station is just up the block.  It is about 15 minutes walk to the Duomo and a 13 euro cab ride to the Uffizi Gallery.  Many nice places to eat close by in the Old City. It is in the process of being renovated so some of the rooms are wonderful and some need help still.  We started in a room that faced the trolley rails and it was quite noisy.  Got a change and faced the courtyard which was much better for sleep.   Rooms and bathrooms are quite small but this is Italy. The reception desk was very helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent.

title: Lovely and modern hotel with excellent location
review: The hotel had a good location close to the Florence rail station and also the trolley end of line (which goes out of the city).  It was within walking distance to the old city center and all of the exciting historic sites, and in turn one could walk to many restaurant.  The hotel seemed like an older hotel, and my balcony view to the front of the hotel overlooked an inactive old building and trolley tracks, which was perfectly fine.  Although it was an older hotel (everything in Florence has some age to it), it was clean and comfortable, and I would consider using them again.   My group ate breakfast there which was very good with a nice selection of items.

title: close to station
review: We had seen some bad reviews but all in all it was a comfortable hotel, the room we were allocated on the 3rd floor at the back was spacious considering we were 3 persons, clean and had all we needed. Breakfast buffet had all you desired and was replenished continuously by the speedy waiters. The receptionists were uncooperative and unhelpful, especially the Head Receptionist who didn't want to know and the fat blonde woman who really needs people skills and perhaps another type of job! The hotel is 10 minutes' walk to the centre.

title: Above Average Tour Hotel
review: Londra is well situated close to SMN railway station and buses to Pisa airport. It a very short walk to the hotel. Its also a 15 mins walk from Londra to the Fortessa Firenze conference centre.  The reception staff were friendly enough, but not really that interested at the same time. Bar staff were friendly and helpful.   The tram goes past the front of the hotel where my room was, but reasonably soundproofed with window/balcony door closed, and aircon worked. Breakfast was fine, but run of the mill.....my room didn t resemble any of the pictures on website, clearly not every floor has been refurbed, it was fine, everything I needed was there, if a tad old fashioned. Kettle etc was a bonus!  But the hotel really wins on location and price!! It also close ( 10 mins) to the Duomo…

title: Worst hotel experience ever
review: We used this hotel as a stop on a tour of Rome, Florence, Bologna, and Venice through a tour operator.  It had nice rooms with good and clean bathrooms.  The comp  breakfast was really good and in an attractive eating area.  The lobby was OK and the hallways a bit shabby but overall a good experience within walking distance of all the sites,

title: Close to Station
review: This was the worst hotel experience of my life. The staff were rude, especially the huge blonde woman behind the front desk who rolled her eyes at me every time I asked her something. As if she were doing me the biggest favour. The room was filthy and stank of cigarettes even tho I'd requested a non smoking room. The sheets were dirty. The floor was filthy. All rooms are on the railway track. Never slept a wink the trains going all night screeching to a halt. Was bitten by bed bugs! Oh my goodness, please don't ruin your time in beautiful Florence by staying on the wrong side of the tracks. I could cry just thinking about this horrible experience!!!

review: We booked this hotel through a hotel booking site. At arrival, not impressed by the rooms wich are in great need of a renovation. Aircon was living it on life during the night, very noice. Situated on a street with more or less only Tram traffic.

title: Never again
review: I stayed at Hotel Londra last August.  The room is clean & well maintained. However its interior & furnishings & amenities seemed to have time traveled from the 80s. Service is average, obligatory & mechanical.  A fairly good location, near city center, though most taxi driver complained about the detour to get to the hotel. If you are looking for budget no frills hotel, this hotel is fine.

title: Not what I expected but it turned out OK
review: Hotel stunk of smoke and carpets were thick with dirt . Room was reasonably modern and although it was a non smoking room there was an ashtray in the bathroom .The aircon pushed the smell of smoke around. Non smoking sign near the elevator had 2 ashtrays either side of it.After having a restless night struggling to breathe went out to the front of the Hotel to be confronted by vomit . The hotel did give us another room which was slightly better.

title: Gorgeous hotel but awful staff
review: Our trip through Italy included a one day/night stay in Florence.  As we drove up to the hotel I was thinking that there must have been a mistake in the reservation.  Are there two Hotel Londas in Florence?  No.  This was the hotel, in a out of the way section of Florence by the train station.  It almost felt deserted.  Not the scenery I was expecting in Florence, but then again, none of the scenery of Florence was what I expected.  The decor of the hotel lobby, bar, & restaurant was crisp, clean and modern.  The hallways and our rooms were dated but very spacious and clean (we had one triple and one double).  The bathrooms, however, were updated, lovely and also very clean.  The breakfast was served in the very roomy restaurant area (no tripping and sliding through…

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: Florence is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. One area that is, sadly, not beautiful is the one around the railway station of Santa Maria Novella, devastated by WW2 bombings and quite ugly. Here is where the Hotel Londra is situated, in an ugly, 1960s building. Yes, is it near the station; yes, it is near the conference centre; yes, it is walking distance from the fantastic Duomo etc; but that does not justify the shabbiness of the rooms, the unfriendliness of the staff, the ants in the rooms, the lights not working, the insufficient air conditioning, the doors not closing properly... what a pity! It deserves a better management.

title: Poorly maintained hotel
review: I stayed for 4 nights with Hotel Londra in May and it was a pleasant stay. I had 2 triple rooms for my family of 6 and we got upgraded. The rooms were very modern, comfortable and clean. It was not particularly spacious but I didn't feel like it was very cramped. Breakfast was adequate though the varieties did not change during our stay at all. There is champagne for those who enjoy a little bubbly in the mornings.   The location of the hotel was quiet but yet walkable to the city centre for sightseeing and shopping. The wifi worked pretty well as well. There seemed to be large groups staying in the hotel during my stay but I never thought that it was noisy or crowded which is a plus. All in all, a pretty enjoyable stay.

title: A minor disappointment..
review: We had 3 nights at this hotel. First impressions it appeared ok but once we started using the facilities we discovered it was very flawed.  On the plus side they offered tea and coffee making facilities - the only hotel on our tour to do so. Sadly this was outweighed by the negatives of a bathroom that became a swimming pool each time the shower was used, a broken toilet where the water ran all night, Poorly maintained gym equipment and out of order sauna. Dirty carpets in the communial areas and stairs. The breakfast was ok but staff unfriendly and rude regarding seating - barking orders at the guests really isn't acceptable!  We also had an evening meal there which was very average.

title: Good location and views
review: I stayed at Hotel Londra inn Florence with a friend last week (13/07/14 - 19/07/14) for an art course. The rooms were extremely reasonably priced for a four star hotel: they were clean and pleasant (although quite basic and bare).  Initially, we were put in a room without a balcony and with such a poor view of the back of other ugly hotels and roofing we asked to move. Unfortunately, there was no space to move for the first night, but the staff were very helpful and allowed us to move the next morning. Our new room had a balcony facing the street. It still was not the typical "florentine" beautiful view but it was so much better and it was so nice to sit there for sunset. Unfortunately, there was no balcony furniture, but we just took a bedside table and two chairs and left them…

title: Average hotel close to the main train station
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Very nice and very close to Florence SNM train station
review: I chose this hotel as it is close the to main SMN train station. The hotel surroundings are quiet at night but well lit. The hotel exterior left much to be desired for. Its an old fashion hotel ( nothing contemporary as the pictures might lead you to think). The staff at the hotel seems ok. The humour was dry but I like it! (for example, I asked where the bus station was (to get to the Mall) and he laughed and said that I am here to shop, when I asked if the hotel wifi connection needed a password..he replied that people these days cannot live without the internet...It may come across as being blunt to others). The rooms were old and musty (nothing like the professional pictures!). Lighting was with halogen bulbs..so its dark and gloomy.  Breakfast was average at best, nothing…

title: Nice quiet place
review: I spent a week at this hotel and enjoyed my stay very much.  It is very close to the Florence SNM train station, yet is off the main street so doesn't have the noise and traffic one would expect from its location.  Housekeeping was very good.  Breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was excellent and large.  Although espresso was not a part of the breakfast buffet, it was available on request with no trouble. I  noticed a few spots on walls and carpet that looked like they could stand some sprucing up, but nothing major.  My only complaint, if it can be called a complaint, is that there was no concierge service, and the front desk staff was not particularly helpful in getting local transportation information, recommending off-site places to eat or visit, etc.  Otherwise,…

title: Wonderful stay in Florence
review: The rooms are clean and the size spacious by European standards.  It is near the Railroad station but a bit far from the historical center of Florence. I had a room facing the street which surprisingly had very little traffic so it was quiet.  The free breakfast great with a large selections of choices.

title: Tarnished Four Stars
review: We stayed at this hotel from October 24 to 27, 2013 as a family. We chose this as our hotel in Florence mainly because it had a parking lot. We were driving from Milan and we planned to plan to go around Tuscany, in San Gimignano, Sienna and Montepulciano and we needed accessible parking. The location of the hotel is nice as it is near the central part of Florence. You could walk anywhere. It is near the train and the bus stations and the famous Florence leather market. We booked a double room and a triple room. Both were large, furnished adequately and clean. The bathrooms were likewise of good size and clean. The front office personnel are friendly enough, though of course, there is still that language barrier.  They gave us very good dining suggestions. All the Florentine…

title: Underrated!
review: Since everything in Florence is within walking distance, it would be difficult to have a bad location anyway, but this one is conveniently just down the street from the train station and just on the other side of all of the noise that is central Florence making for a good night's rest.  Also, there were plenty of good restaurants just around the corner (but don't miss the hotel's chocolate croissants in the morning buffet!).  We enjoyed the comfortable beds and the balcony, which overlooked the parking square--the latter peaceful enough to enjoy a glass of wine and the former great to come back to after a long day walking the city.    The hotel also offered free wifi throughout the hotel (none of the constant re-logging in required elsewhere in the country) and was spacious…

title: nice hotel
review: I have book this hotel,because my preferred ones were notavailable,for a n usual reason of catalyctmic event - fashion week or something similar. On approach I've been pleasantly surprised - clean,well maintained entrance,spacious and bright front desk area,smiling staff. Check in was prompt,keys handed over and I was in the room - large,clean and fair size bed and TV set. It has been noticed,that hotel has its own,dedicated garage,not an usual feature in Florence. Location excellent,just few steps from railway station,but far enough to be away from usual train station people. Breakfast was really good,with good variety of fresh food. Bottom line - very good place in excellent location,garage comes on top.

title: Good breakfast
review: Nice hotel, located conveniently for the station and an easy walk to the old town. Good restaurants nearby as well. Very good choice for breakfast, hotel staff were very friendly.  agree with oterh reviews that the room was larger than any I have stayed at in Rome.

title: Big room, good location
review: Enjoyed the breakfast here very much, a good selection of food, although the coffee was not to my taste.  The room was larger than our room in Rome, with small balcony that overlooked a parking lot.  The thermostat was a bit tricky but we got the hang of it on day two.  Good wifi.  You're not in your room anyway, only to sleep, right?  Otherwise nice hotel.  Oh, the restaurant had the best gnocchi on the planet.  Eat it!

title: Good decent hotel!
review: Rooms are newly refurbished, not extremely spacious but nice and clean overall. Does not stand out in any way but still is a good choice for professionals or someone on holiday who wants to enjoy Florence without using a car. Breakfast is ok, cannot bear the absence of fresh fruit thus. Gym definitely not acceptable for a ****.

title: Good hotel, great location
review: I recently came back from my holiday to Florence, took a coach from Pisa airport to Florence, took about an hour.. When we arrived at Florence station, we walked back to the hotel (8 minutes walk) . Hotel was situated on a quiet road with other hotels, reception was decent looking, the receptionist who checked us in (Antonio) was a friendly man, he helped us arrange our bedroom to 3 single beds, as I didn't request it. Breakfast was included in our price, which was a good selection. Tea, Coffee, Ham toast etc. Buffet style. However one disadvantage is that the walk to the main area where the Doumo was took abit long. Roughly about 20 minutes, other than that was a decent pleasure stay. Very powerful showers!!!  Other positives is that the Rooms had a fridge! So we could buy our…

title: Very pleasant for a trip to Florence
review: Florence was the second stop on a delayed-honeymoon tour of Italy. We stayed at Hotel Londra and it was the perfect location for the activities we had planned. The train station is a typical meeting point and is within walking distance. The hotel staff was nice and our room was comfortable. It was more contemporary than I expected, for sure. We had a nonsmoking room, but must've been near a smoking room because we could smell it wafting in. The staff quickly sent someone to investigate and even freshen our room. We had lunch here twice, but the food wasn't impressive. Overall a decent place to stay.

title: Quite location in a busy city
review: We were at the Londra and it is a very good hotel indeed. Our room (high floor looking towards the south towards the road with tram) was extremely quiet, clean, bigger then expected and overlooking the south-eastern part of Florence. First of all I loved being out of the tourist zone, but still near the centre. Santa Maria Novella for example is at most ten minutes on foot, and in front of the hotel there are no masses of people. Therefore the nights are quiet. The breakfast is ok, nothing exceptional but they have fresh fruit salad, bakery, croissants and warm food. If something was really outstanding it was the kindness and helpfulness of the reception desk.

title: Good and bad
review: We stayed in this Hotel for 3 nights in January 2014 and were on a 4 week European holiday celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a very good size (considering alot of Hotels in Europe are small). Even though this hotel is on the Grand Canel with all the hussel and bussell going on outside, our room was very quite. We had a fantastic view with huge windows looking out onto the canal. The bed was so comfy. Just one thing, if you are including the buffet breakfast this is only cold meats etc not hot. You have to pay extra for hot meals. Very central and walk to most things. Would highly recommend staying at this Hotel.

title: Better every time
review: My room in this hotel was nicely laid out, spacious enough, had a large bathroom and was very clean. Unfortunately, I constantly heard flushing toilets and the heater thermostat made an annoying noise when turning off and on. The staff here were on the whole, very cold and not particularly welcoming, which surprised me. Breakfast was quite extensive and well presented. The location is convenient. Not sure I can recommend it though.

title: Awful
review: We stayed at the Londra again. Its breakfast is wonderful. I look forward to the variety and freshness. The rooms have been updated to a modern motif. The location near the Train station allows ease of passage for day trips. The management went out of their way to meet our needs.

title: Good location, lots of potential
review: What a truly awful hotel. Booked on the back of the trip advisor reviews. It's enough to put me off reading reviews. Really awful area. Seedy, slummy and dirty. Walked through the door of the hotel into some kind of 1970s time warp. Travelling with 2 kids so had booked a family room. Reception said they had given us 2 connecting rooms - great. Went up to the rooms - damp on corridor walls leading up to rooms. I do not know where all these lovely blue lit rooms are that are reviewed on tripadvisor are reviewed but our rooms were dated (still circa 1970). Overlooked a car park. Mattresses and pillows were like rocks. Only covers on beds were sheet and bed spread. The connecting rooms - they were 2 separate rooms only made private by closing the door in the corridor before these 2…

title: Good location but mattress is too hard
review: Hotel Londra has a relais & chateaux rating so it was surprising to me that the hotel was not up to what I expected.  The plus is that is has a great location, walking distance from Plaza San Marcos and the water taxi leaves you right in front of the hotel.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating .  The rooms are nicely decorated and fairly clean.  But the hotel common areas need renovation they look dirty and run down,  the bed linens are of poor quality and the mattress and pillows are not comfortable. If you stay in one of the rooms facing the canal be prepared to listen to the street noise all night.

title: Good hotel and location
review: I usually don't write review/comments but since we travel overseas at least twice a year and I always look up Tripadvisor for reviews on hotels, restaurants....and found the posted info were very helpful so I feel I owe to the community to share the goods and bads.... Anyway, Hotel Londra is in a very good location, a few steps from train station and walking distance from shops, but the mattress is very hard to sleep on.  The laminated wood floor make you can hear all the movement upstairs from other guests.

title: Good location with amenities nearby .
review: Hotel room looked great. The additional blue lights really lifted the room. The location was excellent, very close to the main square. There were tram stops a few meters away but we never used them, just walked around. However, we did pay for parking at the hotel.

title: Just Perceft!
review: This hotel is fairly convenient with restaurants nearby . The bus station where one can take to The Mall outlet is just 2 mins' walk away. Rooms are of good size . I was given 2 rooms which were located far away but the Staff did not have an issue when I asked for two rooms to be as close as possible . They managed to give me 2 rooms side by side . This is also one of the few hotels italy with coffee/ tea maker facilities which is very important as it reduces the hassle of having to buy bottled water all the time.

review: I read some negative reviews before we visited Londra , some spoke about unfriendly reception & some about poor quality. We were a bit worried but we were prepared in case something was not good enough.  To our surprise, everything was completely opposite and things went better than planned. The hotel is located in great location close to Santa Maria Novella Station, probably 5 mins by walk. We had a baby stroller all the time so we were moving slowly. From the station all tourist locations are within 5-10 mins walk.  Breakfast was great, similar to 5 star hotels in Italy. Nearby the station, there were plenty of good restaurants and 1 big supermarket which was also very convenient..  Staff were surprisingly amazing, all of them smiling and helpful all the time. The hotel booked…

title: Good hotel in Florence
review: I stayed here for a few days for a business trip, and I really like this quaint little hotel. Its more like a boutique hotel, but within walking distance of the train station, i.e. less than 5 minutes. It is also located in a area where there are some very good restaurants, and also is not too far away from the central of Florence. The room is not that big, but clean and good quality mattress, pillows and bath amenities. Breakfast has a good selection, though after a few days of eating the same fare, does get a bit boring. They should change the selection, even if slightly on a few mornings in a week. Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Florence, either for business or even for a holiday.

title: Excellent 4-star hotel near the central train station
review: We stayed in this hotel on family trip for a couple of nights to Florence. As we been travelling in and out by train, also including day trip to Pisa, proximity to train station was one ( not the most important ) criterious. The choice of hotel depended on availability of triple family rooms and good price/quality balance. And "Londra" did well in all aspect. Hotel is located in Santa Maria Novela train station area - when arrived, take right exit, turn right, walk a few hundred metes and take slightly left, along tram way - hotel would be just on right. To the Ponte Vechio bridge, if you not lost, it takes not more then 0,5 hour by walking - so it's really everything you can reach on walk within Florence old city center - really pleasure. Positive: location; spacious family…

title: RUDE RECEPTION and service..
review: I was in Florence on a tour and stayed at this hotel for five nights.  It is very close to the central train station in Florence and an easy walk to all the major tourist attractions in the city.  The street is very quiet, but there are many restaurants and shops just a block away near the train station.  The staff are great.  All of the desk staff are fluent in English and are extremely helpful.  They all knew me by name and room number within a day.  The included breakfast is excellent with eggs, sausages, bacon, all types of breads, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, yogurt, milk, juices, coffee, and even sweets.  The internet in the hotel is great. They have 50 megabit service, which provides very high speed service even with a full hotel.  I was in room 624 and had strong…

title: Good if you want to be by the station
review: Looks like a nothing hotel from the outside and across the street looks like an abandoned building.  However, the location is good across from the train station  and you can walk to just about everything including the leather market, Academia, Uffizzi, etc.   The staff was friendly and gave us two good restaurants to go to and we went back to one of them twice.    The breakfast was very nice and plentiful.  We booked the Florance for Foodies food tour and that was the highlight for us in Florance besides seeing The David.

title: Nice modern hotel in Florence
review: Only about 15 minute walk to most of the main attractions, there are certainly a lot of other hotels closer to them. However, I was only there for 3 days and had several bags with me so I wanted to be closer to the main train station to use that as my base. It was perfect for that scenario, decent neighborhood but there is a tram that runs out front (it didn't bother me at all though). The hotel itself is quite nice actually, breakfast was good (bacon, scrambled eggs, typical meats, cheeses and breads etc). Wifi available for free. However, it was very easy to hear your neighbors. We were woken by the maid vacuuming halfway down the hallway and several banging doors. Other than that no complaints really. Good hotel if you want to be by the station, average hotel if you want to…

title: Great Stay
review: I stayed here during the middle part of my tour with Insight Vacations.   I didn't spend too much time in the hotel because I was out and about exploring wonderful Florence. However, the hotel itself is more modern than historic, clean and very nice. It's a bit old-fashioned in that you leave your key at the front desk when you exit the hotel but I found it charming and very classic.   The breakfast was amazing. They had great eggs, bacon, fruit, breads, etc ... but best of all they had Nutella-filled croissants!! They were absolutely delicious. Great coffee and tea as well.   The rooms were average in size but clean and tidy. The bathrooms were clean and nice as well. Not a luxury hotel but a nice stay in a very expensive city. Overall I enjoyed it very much!

title: Simple but good hotel.
review: Only a short walk from train station and all the main attractions, while passing so many bars, cafés and many quaint restaurants. The front desk staff are very friendly and efficient which makes check in and out very smooth.. Breakfast is good with a lot of choices from scrambled eggs and bacon to cereal, yoghurt and very fresh fruit.. The room was great, very clean, spacious and very well appointed. Bed was very comfy and large.  Must mention Sofia, lady that worked in the bar one night..Extremely friendly, polite, very professional and mixes the "perfect" cosmopolitan.... A credit to the hotel

title: A good place to stay.
review: A confortable hotel, but the first time I have heard my neighbour I believed that someone entred in my room during the night.  I think that it is representative of the bad acoustic insulation of this hotel.

title: Okay, but could be better.
review: We enjoyed our stay in this very nice hotel. It's very conveniently located; just a short walk from the train station and in a very quiet area. It's within easy walking distance of all the main attractions in Florence and we would definitely stay here again. The champagne breakfast was more than adequate and apart from the usual continental fare, there was also scrambled eggs and sausages provided. We would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Florence for its location and friendly staff.

title: Decent rooms but Poor location
review: Stayed here recently while on tour of Europe and was disappointed in the amount of noise that came through from the railway side of the building. It sounded like a jet taking off at times. I'd recommend asking for a room away from that side. The breakfast was pretty good and Florence is worth the visit. Like I said in the header - it could be better!

title: Over promises
review: The room sizes are quiet good and spacious with a balcony. However, its located very far from the central city... It takes about 30 mins by walk. It is 7-8 mins away from the main station. Breakfast is very ordinary. However, the restaurants are beautifully done up.

review: Well located hotel within walking distance to city centre and attractions. Hotel is comfortable with a good breakfast and air conditioned rooms which is a must in the summer. Staff were not the friendliest but did not detract too much. Stayed at hotel with Insight Vacations bus tour.

title: Terrible front desk!! So rude!!!!
review: Hotel was very close to the city center and train station. This was very important. However staff was very unfriendly, except the barmen, who was extremely nice and polite.  During breakfast staff was not attentive and although it was a self service was hardly answering questions of the first comers.  Receptionist was very inefficient. We had to wait quite a long queue until receptionist spoke to someone and wait until someone else will come to get our payment for checkout.  In addition we had story with cleaner: she didn't put the bathroom supplies on a daily basis, or instead of 3 shampoo would put 1. Also I lost my shirt, which I left on the arm chair. I assume it was taken along with changed begging, as shirt was white, but no one has reacted to this. I called receptionist 3…

title: Nice
review: The hotel location and the rooms are good, but the attitude the stuff has are terrible.  It just ruined everything.  I paid for a king size bed and god a twin.  When i asked to change to what i paid for they said (rudely!!!!!) that they dont have rooms.   Dont stay there. Choose other hotels..there are planty.

title: Modern with nice location.
review: I stayed here in June end with family during our one day visit to Pisa and Florence. A very nice Hotel located near Station (walkable). It doesn't seem nice from front but rooms are great and balcony is also huge with a wonderful view. Rooms facilities are nice as well specially Jacuzzi. There are couple of Indian restaurants near by and also the City or tourists spots can be approached by walk of around a KM. Breakfast was usual.

title: Average stay & rooms aren't anything special
review: We travelled with 2 young children and had a wonderful stay. The room was possibly the best hotel room I've stayed in and the service was such that my wife genuinely thought they'd mistaken us for minor celebrities! A bonus for parents was that we had a balcony (with amazing views of Florence) where we would go and chat over a beer or two while the children drifted off to sleep inside. Location great - 5 mins walk from Santa Maria Novella station and 10 minutes from the centre. Can't recommend highly enough.

title: Great Florentine weekend
review: Rooms are quite average, small & I've seen a better job done with fixing up the room. Ok location. Skip breakfast! Breakfast was horrid & will not touch it again. Will most likely not book here again.

title: Adequate hotel, good location
review: Stayed for 3 nights in the hot summer month of August.Room was very good ,clean and comfortable ,good air con ,large size of room,great bed,plenty of towels and sound proof.Though the hotel is close to SMN train station its on a road leading away from it so there is not too much noise.Had a nice little balcony too.Tea coffee making facilities in room. Breakfast was good but no change of menu so that got boring.Lots of crowds for breakfast early in the morning.Better to be there at around 9 am to start your day at peace and also for a fresh batch of the breads and hot dishes. The restaurant is decent,not too many options for lunch.For dinner they have a whole menu.There are several good restaurants around SMN church so it is not a problem. Front desk was quite helpful.Bathroom…

title: Lukewarm  coffee and thick!
review: The location of the hotel was really good, the other reviewers are correct in that you can easily walk to the sights and shopping throughout Florence. There were many restaurants nearby, and they were quite good. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, so we cannot comment on that, but I am sure it was fine. The room itself was adequate, clean and had amenities that one would need while travelling. The hotel safe can contain iPads and MacAir, so it was a very good size. It was quiet most of the time, however the morning rail starts around 6 or 7am so you can hear some rumblings but it wasn't too bad.  The hotel staff were not overly friendly, however they helped when needed, so no complaints with this aspect.   All in all I think our stay was good at this hotel, I would like to…

title: Beautiful Hotel and Close to Train Station
review: I went to Florence for a long weekend to celebrate my best friend's wedding (crazy, I know!). The Londra was the sister hotel to where many of the events were taking place and less expensive so I chose to stay there. It was a great choice because I was able to walk to many of the sights, restaurants and shopping but I feel that they are a little overpriced for what you get. I've stayed in small boutique-style hotels before and know what to expect, but this was a little ridiculous and it was a good thing I left the hubs at home. Pros: clean room, comfy bed and pillows, nice TV, ample closet space, nice breakfast buffet. Cons: tiny bathroom, an even tinier shower (same size as a cruise ship - really??), only two English TV channels (that wouldn't be bad except for the fact they…

title: Decent price for comfort in Florence
review: This is a very beautiful hotel.  It is within walking distance of the train station.  Everyone at the hotel was wonderful, first-class, friendly, and professional.  The restaurant, One, was very good and had excellent service.  Rooms were already prepared and ready when we arrived.  The rooms were clean and had large flat screen TV.  The breakfast buffett that they offer with the cost of the room was the largest I have seen in a hotel.  They had everything from scrambled eggs and bacon, to fresh pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, Italian lunch meats, and yogurts with fresh juice and milk.  We loved this hotel and highly recommend!

title: Very good hotel in central location
review: Hotel was comfortable for the price (booked on hotelstonight).  Location was central to the train station and tram, but a walk from the sites. The room itself was large and comfortable for European city standards in this price range.   Above average breakfast buffet.

title: Everything except for reception is very good!
review: Very central location just beside the railway station. Well priced. Rooms were very modern and clean. Nice courtyard area to relax in the evening.the hop on hop off transport for sightseeing is nearby.  The accommodation was well priced. The staff were professional in approach. Breakfast was adequate and set is up for the day.

title: Modern rooms, excellent location
review: Florence is expensive and it's very difficult to find and excellent hotel for the price I payed here. The hotel is 4 star rated, new and situated near the train station. The rooms are comfortable, clean and modern. I didn't like the reception staff but complessivelly I would reccomand it.

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Stayed for one night with a family. The room was very good, modern and well-equipped. Free Wi-Fi. Close by the train station and not far away from the main streets to visit. Very friendly staff. We came in the morning, but they allowed us into the room. Upon request they printed our boarding passes without extra fee.   We liked the breakfast. Nevertheless I would suggest to supply the food till the last moment. We came half an hour before the breakfast ends, and some food has already been consumed. The staff did not bring the new one.

title: Must try Harder
review: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel while traveling with a school group in June/2013.  It was a lovely hotel kind of off the beaten path however, we did walk to the town center and Accademia so it was doable.  The hotel was nicely decorated with an old-timey feel.  The elevators were teeny tiny so only one person with bulky luggage could use one at a time.  Fortunately, we were on the 3rd floor so we always walked up and down except when we had to tote our bags.  The room was adequate for our stay.  The breakfast buffet was very good with many choices including scrambled eggs.

title: Could be improved!
review: As far as the rooms and location are concerned the hotel is very good. Being next to the station was ideal for us as we had an early train to catch and the room was very comfortable, clean and modern. It is a short walk into the central hub of Florence, but there are nice restaurants in the surround area. The sauna is also very nice after a long day sightseeing, and i really enjoyed the courtyard bar in the evening. The only let down for me was the reception staff. I would expect a warm welcome and helpful advice from the staff at any hotel reception, especially one marketing itself as 4 star and in this price range. However this was not what i experienced here, i found them to be cold and got the impression i was bothering them when i approached with questions. If they could…

title: Hotel need reconstruction
review: The hotel gives the impression of being a nice hotel but leaves a lot to be desired in so many areas.  Our room was nice, our bed comfortable, but the bathroom spelt of sewage.  There was no bath in our room and the shower had two moveable walls which leaked.  This caused the floor to be flooded each time we took a shower.  No milk was provided for the in-room coffee/tea.  Others on our tour complained their bed was lumpy and some rooms spelt badly of cigarette smoke.  The internet is free and performs well.  However they ask you to logon using your email address as the password.  When I asked reception why, as no other hotel I have stayed did this, the arrogant guy on reception there said if I didn’t like it then “don’t use it”.   Very rude!  The in-house prices for food,…

title: Good Location, comfort and price
review: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. Hotel is a little cold - espescialy the shared areas.  Hotel need a reconstruction for sure!!! Shared areas are OK I guess they reconstructed them.  Our room was smelly, the smell went from the drawn, when we turn the water on it went away, but always when we got to the room the smell just hit you. The walls were dirty and they should be repainted. Wifi extremly slow. Staff was OK, I came late for breakfast, I didnt realize it was already after breakfast, the weiter brought me a coffee and a selection of croassants which was very nice of him.

title: Pretty good...except the staff
review: Near to the train station, but a nice and quiet place, even staying in the same street of tramway. Has been possible to go with luggage including my parents older. Comfortable space for 4 people. The bathroom was nice, the towels were changed everyday. I've heard a little noise by the neighbor room at night, but nothing that disturberd us. I go back again and I recommend.

title: I'd go back again
review: Cool hotel, really close to the train station, we really liked the room- funky. Staff was a little snotty and rude- I asked if I could make collect calls from the room phone which they said I could and then charged 28 euros.  Super annoying. We came in for lunch a little late (we had been traveling all day) and the waiter was visibly annoyed that we were keeping him - but got better after because we ordered quickly and left a nice tip. Would recommend this hotel overall however.  Pretty good price for Florence.

title: Very nice hotel
review: Location is very close to the train station.  It is about 20 minutes average (flat) walk to the main cathedral, but some of our group did get lost on the way.  Perfect location if you are coming in on the trains.  We stayed on the sixth floor and the room was spacious, clean and quiet.  The air conditioning worked, the bathroom had good water pressure and the bed was comfortable.  Only complaint would be that the hair dryer seemed to be asthmatic and not very effective.  The breakfast was good with an adequate range.  The staff on reception were not very attentive and often talked amoung themselves even when customers were waiting.  Overall a nice relaxing stay.

title: Very relaxing stay
review: Our room was of good size, the service was good, the tourist information from the front desk was very inaccurate preventing us from entering the cathedral.  Except for the front desk no one knew much if any English and  I found it hard to explain to the bar/restaurant that my wife was not feeling well and that  I wanted some coffee and some sort of pastry to take to our room.  The problem was my lack of Italian.    The hotel itself is less than a quarter mile from the train station and I would recommend using the side exit instead of the front as it cuts the walking distance considerably. This does require a large number of stair steps.  The front entrance of the terminal has few stairs.    As were most hotels in our trip the exterior of the hotel was surrounded by old…

title: Friendly hotel in a central location
review: We spent several days kin the Hotel Londra while our tour was visiting Florence:  my teenage granddaughter was traveling with me.  We checked into the hotel at the exact time when we needed a relaxing break in our touring and the Londra was perfect.  The staff was helpful and welcoming:  the room was comfortable and very clean:  the bar/garden was a cool, lovely oasis and great place for a drink.  I would even recommend the hotel restaurant if you don't want to go out for dinner.  As everyone has noted, the location is perfect for getting the train or walking to the city center.

title: “Good hotel for visiting Florence”
review: Florence was the third city we visited in Italy during our Easter Holidays. Although our Florence visit was a short one, we thoroughly enjoyed our two-day stay at  Hotel Londra with its central location - near the Santa Maria Terminal. We found it especially convenient as we travelled by Trenitalia Train from Milan to Florence. The hotel was less than 10 minutes' walk from the Terminal. Our triple room in the hotel was spacious and comfortable, complete with almost everything, except a coffee maker (typical of most Italian hotels). The only thing my wife complained about was the absence of a shower cap in the bath room. The buffet breakfast was good with a great variety to choose from.  The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating. They even helped us to get a taxi to go…

title: Fantastic Service!
review: The only thing I remember about this hotel is its great location. It is walking distance to the shops and the tourist sights. Florence is one of my favorite place and would definitely come back to this hotel.

title: Modern Florence in the midst of Antiquity
review: My stay at the Hotel Londra Florence, was excellent. The staff were exceptional, they were friendly, welcoming and very helpful! The location of the Hotel is great, very close to everything. I would like to mention Francesso Tadei, he made our stay perfect! I would highly recommend this Hotel.

title: Good hotel for visiting Florence ,staff is problem !
review: Because of its convenient location within walking distance to the RR station and the sights, I have stayed at the Londra twice now and would have given top review for the first time. Our room was in the back with a lovely view of the hills from our terrace. Upon entering this ultra modern room, you are surprised by the cobalt blue lights that backlight the mirrors which also contain the flat screen tvs in the bedroom and bathroom.  The room was all clean lines and a pristine white. The bathroom had a square toilet and bidet but the clear shower door did not protect the floor so we had to put down towels. The next visit, we were on the side of the road. It was noisy from the electric tram that ran all night so if you book, get a room in the rear. The breakfast was excellent with…

title: Great Location
review: We stay in Londra hotel in December for 5 nights ! The location is very good , close to everything what You want to visit in Florence ! First room which they try to give us was horible old and dirty nothing to do with room we booked, person at reception desk was very rude and unprofesional ,but after while kind lady there help us and we finally get what we paid for , one nice newly renovated room .Bed was good size and comfy and You get bathrobe and slippers as well .Room was cleaned very good each day .Brakfast was o.k. nothing special but not bad . expensive parking.

title: breaking and entering in hotel londra firenze
review: We stayed 3 nights in December 2012. I have stayed there before and return for its location, ammenities and atmosphere.  The american buffet breakfast is the best I have had in Italy. It is very close to the rail road termini which makes day trips very handy. The staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms are modern, clean and recently update. I will stay there again.

title: Excellent value
review: I stayed in hotel londra firenze Check-in: September 24, 2012 Check-out: September 28, 2012,under booking.com reservation number 281123989.a thief broke in by breaking the door (the deadbolt door) around 9:00pm. lost camera etc.the management didnot care and suggested i reported to the police which i did.they provided no transport to the police station,so i had to order a taxi myself.Management said that after received the complaint,hotel insurance would issue traveler cheque. which i never received until now.I already contact the management many times,they never reply!my advice,if you had a break in in your room. call the police from the room.let them come and make scene.

title: Breathtaking
review: The Londra is not in the most historic, fashionable part of town (though it is very convenient to the station), but it's pretty quiet and an easy 10 minute walk to the main tourist sites in the city center. The rooms are quite large (think standard "Best Western" size if you're from America) and pleasant, there's good free WiFi, and an excellent breakfast buffet. We found the staff very helpful - needing a hot water bottle for a bad back late at night the front desk obliged promptly. This is not a luxury hotel, but it would not surprise me if they charged 50% more so for the actual price it's an excellent value!

title: Modern decor in a Renaissance world
review: Our favorite hotel of a time. Gorgeous view, great location, friendly staff. We had a balcony overlooking the lagoon that had us feeling like royalty. We highly recommend this hotel and will always stay there when we visit again.

review: location was near train station, but fairly quiet for a street hotel; the rooms are updated and modern and the breakfast wonderful.  A good choice outside the heart of florence. Staff were on top of the rooms; combined quaint with updatedness.

title: A nice hotel in a great location
review: I was on a short trip with my friend who had her birthday. I made a booking online and asked for a double room with single beds. Upon arrival to the hotel i confirmed that we need a room with two separate beds and the woman on the reception said ok and gave the key from a room with a king-sized bed. we had to go down and ask again. and the problem was not with my english or my italian.... it's a small detail but this attitude makes a difference. The location of the hotel is convenient as it's very close to the train station. however it's better to ask for a room with windows which would not face the street as there're tram lines going under and this noise is really killing in the early morning. The rooms were clean. However i guess the management is a bit too much keen on…

title: Great
review: The Hotel Londra has very good wi-fi, decent food and comfortable rooms.  But the best thing is the location.  It is an easy walk to see wonderful old buildings and art.  It is also very close to the train station.  The bar is a bit underwhelming, though we didn't have a chance to avail ourselves of the outside seating.  We did like the little gift shop and my wife bought s very nice purse there at a good price.

title: A Decent Hotel in the City Center
review: Dear Guest, Thank you for your feedback.  The hotel is located at just 200 meters from the train station and close to the most important monuments and churches. The hotel offers 50mb fast and free WI FI connection in all rooms and hotel areas. We hope for good weather in your next visit to Florence so that you can enjoy our lovely garden with wooden floor and surrounded by bamboo with comfortable sofas and armchairs.  Best Regards,   Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra -Firenze-

review: Stayed here as part of a tour. My husband and I ended up with a room that was apparently a disabled room. There was no bath/shower like most rooms instead just a shower with these bi fold doors that meant you could open them right up. You didn't really need it to add space to the bathroom it was spacious enough on it's on. Anyway, I was showering and looked down to see all my toilettries I had in the shower floating around (there was not shelves, made it really difficult) I asked my husband to come in I was worried the shower was not drainig. Which was the case, there was a river running under the shower doors (because they sad flat to the floor there was no lip) across the bathroom and down the other drain. We called reception and they send up a service man to unclog the drain.…

title: Italy via Insight's Italian Intermezzo in Sept 2012
review: Dear Guest, thank you for your review in Tripadvisor.  First of all we are really sorry for any inconvenience during your stay in Florence. The hotel has been designed to accommodate also people with disabilities as the law requires. There are not impediments outside or inside the hotel and rooms. About the mould we informed the housekeeper and she took care immediately, we are undertaking some maintenance to offer a more comfortable stay to all our guests. The ice machine, very useful when the lounge bar is closed, are located on the 1st and 3rd floors, and are kept off during the night. We are sorry for your problem with the WI FI. We offer a free 50mb connection covering all the areas of the hotel and it is usually really appreciated by our guests.  Anyhow, your comments have been much appreciated and helpful we hope to welcome you back.  Best Regards Antonio Dondiego  General Manager  Hotel Londra -Firenze-

title: Nice modern hotel
review: the hotel is located near the train station, central market and is about 20-25 minute walk to almost all the places to visit in the rennaissance city of Florence.  Rooms are spacious and may be dated but still up to the American standard.  Rooms are not sound proof because of the old construction.  Breakfast is included with the room and has a good selection including Mimosa if desired.  Bread for some reason is not typical of european standards. Has one kind of swalumi but no prosciuto which is unusual for an Italian establishment.  Has good selection of cereals but the fruit supply is kind of hit and miss. For Capuccino you have to ask one of the busy wait staff for one.  Over all this is a good place to stay and is in a good location to choose while visiting Florence.

title: Make sure you ask for a renovated room
review: Hotel Londra was wonderful. The Lobby with it nice spacious seating and wonderful Bar Manager Gino allowed our group to really have a great time playing cards and enjoying each other in our group of 38 from FL, Ga, Co, NC, Tx,(.USA) What everyone said was how wonderful the lobby was!!! Our music and impromtu dancing added such a relaxed air while we were on holiday in Italy and the hotel staff was so accomodating!!! This property is absolutely darling. The room I had ( 322 ) was nice and large . The (2),twin beds still allowed plenty of walkaround space. We did use the in-room safe  with ease. The  bathroom was a nice size. We had been told of the scale of the rooms ahead of time and this was better than expected. The half shower door needed more stripping to keep it closed, but…

title: Good location - average hotel
review: I came to this hotel because of the reviews that indicated that it was "technologically advanced"and I was not disappointed.  For me, being able to access the internet is a must have while traveling and this hotel offers the "ferrari"...its free, high speed.  Was able to keep in touch with family by skyping without any problems.  The location is behind the train station..a bit further than other hotels but still easy walking.  Furnishings are modern and I found the bed to be very comfortable.  Showers have ability to be hand held or overhead. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel and found it a great base to sightsee (lots of tours leave from the train station nearby).

title: Good value, great location
review: Stayed on business for 3-nights.  Close to the central station (200m), this hotel provides a convenient base for the city.  Double room (Room 111) was long & thin so awkward to move about in; worst was the location above reception so I got continuously woken by noise below & by the occasional tram passing outside the window.   Breakfast was okay but chaotic at times as large coach parties use this hotel. This hotel has an outside seating area at the rear which is a big plus for an end of day drink or two! I'd stay again but ask for a 'higher' room.

title: Great hotel , near to train station and Florence centre.
review: I stayed here for 2 nights on business. To get to florence we flew into Pisa and then for 7 Euros each caught the train to Florence where the hotel is a 5 minute hop away. We were able to hire meeting room facilities with drinks and pastries etc which although not fantastically modern, provided a comfortable environement for conducting business. Free wifi is provided a standard and the staff are polite and helpful. Breakfast choices are quite varied and the restaurant service and food very nice too if you choose to eat in. It was very busy and obviously a popular spot for tourists due to its central location and easy access to the train station. Overall a great choice. Hopefully I'll get the opportunity to return and take in the sights and pleasures of Florence.

title: Great spot
review: Dear Jumbo1962,  Thank you so much for your opinion in Tripadvisor! I am very glad to read that you’ve enjoyed your stay at Hotel Londra and appreciated some of our offered services and facilities, from meeting room facilities to the inside restaurant.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence and in our hotel, I send you all my Best Regards Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

title: Original decoration and good overall service
review: A very decent hotel just next to the main station. I would not call it a primary location but everything was walking distance away and it is conveniently located if you take any out of the town tours as they tend to use the station as their meeting point. The rooms have a modern decor and everything worked well. There were some little scratched on walls in the bathroom but it didn't destroy the overall view. Breakfast was good and there was plenty of choice. Besides, they did serve champagne for breakfast as was stated in the description and we took advantage of it on our last morning in Florence.  We read some complaints about the hotel staff and I must admit they were not the most smily Italians I have seen in my life but they were okay. We needed to print our gallery tickets…

review: Dear Umniaka,  thank you so much for your review in Tripadvisor! I am very grateful for your words about your stay at Hotel Londra.  Looking forward to welcome you again in Florence, I send you  Best Regards Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

title: Good hotel on the wrong side of the tracks
review: The room had a very unique decoration which looked like something from a science fiction film. It wasn't very big but it was clean and comfortable and certainly original, in a nice way (once you manage to find the light switches). The staff were pleasant and breakfast was good. The location next to the railway station is an advantage if you are travelling by public transport but not easy if you have a car. The hotel's car parking area is quite small and I found it expensive at €20. In general, a satisfactory experience and a hotel I would go back to.

title: Clean, great service, great value
review: Dear Victor,  Thank you so much for your review in Tripadvisor! I am very glad to read that you’ve enjoyed your stay at Hotel Londra and appreciated your accommodation in one of our Feeling Design Rooms. These rooms are recently restored and are characterized by play of lights and mirrors that enhance the linear style of the furniture inspired by contemporary and state-of-the-art elements.  Hoping to welcome you again in Florence and in our hotel, I send you all my  Best Regards  Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

review: I have stayed here twice, once in August 2008 and again on honeymoon for 3 nights in April 2011. I couldn't fault the place really on my first visit. We had a large twin room with a balcony and it was very good value for money when we booked it on booking.com. This was the reason I booked it for myself and my husband on honeymoon. We told the staff on arrival that we were on honeymoon and that I had been there before and we were told we were getting a 'really nice room', so we were delighted until we arrived in the smallest room ever with hardly any space to put our bags. It was a nice room......but for a single person and that was who we realised it was for when I observed the bed was a large single with one pillow and one bedside table....I couldn't believe a couple, let alone…

review: Dear Bella-Clare, thank you so much for your review in Tripadvisor and for your second visit at our hotel!  I apologize that our service not matched with your expectations during a special occasion as your honeymoon. I will personally check with the front desk what happened with your room assignation to carefully analyse and value the matter you mentioned.   Looking forward to welcoming you again in Florence and as special Guest of our Hotel Londra, I send you   Best Regards  Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

title: Worst/arrogant Service
review: Great location, very safe garge on basement, good breakfast and view from room. Modern design but walls made of paper....if u have noisy neigboors you are very unlucky, no way to sleep!! Expensive...

review: From NZ and was on a group tour ,had no probs at all, my ma and i had a balcony twin room overlooking the train track and we found we had heaps of room, and enjoyed the balcony......  the trains compared to NZ trains were really really quite...... loved the outside area down below, especially at night as it was all lit up with lights and the bar staff especially were very friendly, thanks heaps, have no probs recommending to others, thanks for having us, loved europe and hope to come back soon xo

title: Above expectations
review: Dear Lynny,  Thank you so much for your review in Tripadvisor!  First off all… what a beautiful country is the New Zealand!  I am very happy that you and your mother have appreciated your accommodation and your stay at our Hotel Londra.   I hope to welcoming you again in Florence and I send you my  Best Regards  Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

title: Horrible hotel...unless you are on a tour!
review: Good location, but try and get a room not facing the main street where the trolleys and trains go by otherwise it may be noisy unless you have the airconditioning on.  Otherwise a very nice hotel to stay at . Front desk was very helpful and nice people. Breakfast was ok nothing great (actually everything was good but the eggs and bacon was not cooked long enough other than that plenty of choices) but certainly suffcient and clean. I certainly would stay here again.

title: Very good hotel in Florence
review: We spent a month touring all over Europe and out of the 11 hotels we stayed at this was by far the worst one. We were on the 5th floor which apparently is the floor that hasn't been renovated yet; at least that's what I was told. The halls and the rooms had an awful musty smell to them. There was black out curtains just on one side of the window so had to be sure not to get dressed when it's dark outside with the lights on, not to mention how bright the room was very early in the morning. The safe was small (Ipad wouldn't fit) and you need to get a key from reception in order to use it, no combination lock. The taps in the bathroom for both the sink and the shower had to be turned about 20 times before any water would come out. Never needed to turn the cold water tap on as the…

title: Disappointed stay.
review: Dear Guest,   thank you for your Tripadvisor’s review.   I really apologize for the room assigned you and for the problems you highlighted. We have just a couple of rooms that we are going to renovate and in occasion of your stay (hotel fully booked) we must assign also this room.   Your indication are very important and will help us to improve for the future all the features and services of our hotel.   Hoping that you will renew your preference to our hotel in Florence, I send you all my  Best Regards  Antonio Dondiego General Manager Hotel Londra –Firenze-

title: Good and convenient
review: Stayed in this hotel 4 nights in March on Italy tour. Very clean and comfortable with a very nice breakfast buffet. Excellant location. No need for bus or train, although hotel is located near main train station. Walk to center of city , Uffizzi, Pitti Palace, Duomo, Accademia Museum all within 15 minutes. Wi-fi is available in room. (Also unusual in Europe is that they have ice machines on some floors). (Note; there is a train that runs in front of hotel and one or two people complained about noise from the train , but our room, with a very nice view of a garden in the back, was fine. You may want to ask for a room off the front street .) This is a very nice hotel and I would definitely stay there on next trip to Florence.

title: Excellent Hotel near SM Novella

title: Expectations met
review: It was inexpensive and very close to the train station. Room was nothing special and staff seemed helpful.  I could hear our neighbors though.  Our king bed was also just two twins pushed together, creating a gap in the middle.  Everywhere else we got a nice queen bed, but this was just awkward.

title: I will not stay here next time
review: Hotel staff was accommodating in room availability at noon. By European standards, the room was spacious. Double pane windows insulated most of the noise from the trams that pass by on the Via Jacopo da Diacetto.. Breakfast buffet food variety  was good as was the variety of selections. Hotel staff was most helpful and pleasant. One cannot fault the hotel for the number of Japanese guests, however if a choice could be made, this guest would prefer to  avoid the 25+ clot of JPN tourists in the lobby and breakfast areas. The bathroom was spacious  and immaculate. The housekeeping staff was professional and accommodating to  a guest's schedule. The location past the train station, Santa Maria Novella is likely to be a detriment to some patrons.

title: Comfortable hotel
review: Room is very small, odd interior (wrong modern image of London?) and super small bathroom. I felt depressed when I came back to hotel every night. Location is ok, but opposite side of town though it is close to station. I recommend to stay other hotels at the same price range if you consider staying here.

title: Very Good Hotel
review: This hotel is a very good hotel if you do not stay on the top level - remember that - don't stay on the top level. There are three kinds of hotel rooms at this hotel - very bad, ok ones and the very good ones.  It's well located - I was there because of a congress and it took me about 10 minutes to walk there.  Friendly staff and very willing to help you will all shorts of requests.
