title: Very good option
review: I was very happy to rest on the king size bed in a comfortable room after my long (train) journey to Florence, it is very close to the train station. You could hear the tram pass out the front, but it didn't bother us as it wasn't loud with the double glazing. Clean, though a little bit worn, and spacious overall. Breakfast was great, full buffet with bacon, eggs and sausages - and the 90s tv series music playing made us giggle, don't think I've eaten breakfast to the theme song of Baywatch before! Recommended for people who don't mind a walk into town. Close to the Santa Maria Novella church which is worth a visit, and don't miss its Farmacia around the corner, it has free entry.

title: Outstanding!
review: Well located, just 350m from rail station, comfortable and clean room and a nice and well served breakfast. It's not a bargain, but they have a reasonable price compared to other hotels. You can choose this hotel without fear!

title: Spring in Florence
review: Service excellence is one of a hotel’s greatest and distinguishing assets – Hotel Londra is an outstanding example of this.  I am personally so thankful for all they did to make our stay (30+ people in our group) exceptional.  Please extend our sincere appreciation to your staff.  Francesco Taddei, the Event Manager was highly professional and could not have been more accommodating.  I look forward to returning to Hotel Londra for a holiday!

title: Excellent!
review: Hotel was clean - only problem was that it was very warm - no airconditioner :(  had to keep windows opened which attracted mosquitos.  Very convenient to train station.  Breakfast buffet was good.

title: Acceptable if you are with a group
review: Pros: Great location - a less than 5-minute easy walk from the train station in Florence and about a 10-minute walk to the Duomo and city center with shopping, food, etc.  The area was overall very quiet.  Free wi-fi throughout the hotel and computers in the lobby.  The hotel breakfast was very good with hot and cold options including a huge variety of breads, pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal and meat.    Cons:  The room was extremely dated, furnishings and bathroom fixtures were very old and worn. The carpet was dirty.  The beds were the worst part.  I could feel springs all over my bed and was not the only person in my traveling group (group of 31) who had the same complaint.  I very rarely have a problem sleeping anywhere, but had to request blankets from the front desk in…

title: Convenient, clean, friendly service, good breakfast
review: This hotel was so much better than our hotel in Florence last year.  My room was small (as expected, but the bedding was comfortable.  I would have preferred a duvet which has the cover laundered fresh for each guest.  It was cold.  The heat had been shut down for the season (does summer start in April), so the first night I slept with a hooded sweatshirt and socks.  The next night I asked for an extra blanket.  My room had a small bathtub (joy!!) and plenty of white fluffy towels, (not the kind like a dishtowel).  I was very disappointed that the hotel blocked access to my calling card.  It had a nice lobby, a small shop and a lobby bar.  Breakfast was just fine.  Again, you have to ask for real coffee rather than the instant served.  I would not stay here if I were traveling…

title: confortable rooms ... excellent service.
review: A good 4 star hotel in Florence. The building is (I would guess) from the 70s, so it's not the romantic old buildings you might get right in the heart, but means rooms are a good size, and everything works as it should. 5 minute walk (1 minute run) to the station which was ideal for us as we took lots of side trips around Italy. But it's also located in a fairly quiet street, so not too much street noise. breakfast was great, large selection of hot (sausages, bacon, scrambled or boiled eggs) and cold items (cheeses, cold cuts, dried fruit, fresh fruit, yoghurts, etc). Quality was of a high standard consistently during our 7 days. All staff are very friendly and polite. I do have to commend the cleaning staff as well, as I thought they did an excellent job too! All in all, a…

title: Good location, close to station
review: i arrived to the hotel londra with a huge group.... and I found the most helpful people behind the reception desk! beautiful room it looked like my own room. Cofortable and cosy at the same time. Spacious reception clean simple furniture ... Leading a group of 80 it is not an easy task and without the help that I have received it would have been even more challenging.

review: Next time you happen to spend some time in Florence (lucky you!...) do not waste your time and pick this one... you will not regret it. From the extremely helpful, knowledgeable and polite reception to the comfortable mattress of the bedroom, from the amazing buffet-breakfast to the very convenient location just a stone's throw from Piazza Santa Maria Novella. This is a gem of a hotel. Top marks!

title: Hotel Londra, Florence
review: The hotel looks stunning, it's clean and modern and staff is great. We had a little problem and they were so helpful! Nice Breakfast with a large selection of bread . Perfect location

title: The low point of the tour...
review: Hotel Londra was a last minute book for my friends and me but we were able to get a room for three of us and pay very little for the one night we spent in Florence.  The hotel lobby always tells so much about a place and this hotel had a very welcoming entrance.  There seems to have been some moderizing recently which was nice.    The receptionist was pleasant but not overly welcoming.  I would have appreciated more hospitatlity but for one night, it was fine.    The room itself was nice enough and the location was good, just near the train station.  We were able to park in the hotel lot which was a huge bonus as we wanted to walk around town and not worry about the car.    Breakfast was a let down but with options much like any other continental, you have some choice.    We…

title: Noisey and rooms were too hot in the winter.
review: On our 2 week tour of Italy this was the least desirable hotel. The room was clean, but very small with extra firm beds and pillows that matched! The trolleys ran right under the window all night long! The AC was not controllable. They were not able to get me a phone line out so that I could use a phone card. They did, however, have two computers in their lobby that could be used for free. Also, this hotel was not within walking distance of any sights and seemed to be in a sketchy area.

title: Ugh !
review: its a honest 4* italian hotel in good  and quiet location just 100 m. from s.m train station. its really 10 min walk to the center of town (duomo).the staff are very helfull.the breakfast room are very good and the buffet  is nice and rich.the reception area is huge!!! with nice saloon & bar. internet is free!!!!

title: Nice Location, Nice Room, Slightly Expensive
review: 3rd hotel on our insight tour, and pretty bad. Rooms were assigned so we thought everybody got the same. Not so. When we opened the door to the room, it had a smell from standing water in a drain in the floor in the bathroom. That's because the shower stall was a portable screen that just unfolded with no basin to catch the water ! The floor just covered with water when we showered !? Breakfast was yuk...very watery powdered eggs. and stale bread, for example. We were warned about seedy characters in the halls and wouldn't unlock the window. People at the front desk seemed "brisk"...like they were ready for you to complain and they wouldn't be caught off guard. Each time you leave the hotel, you have to leave your key with the front desk !? Not a comfortable situation.

title: Decent hotel for a tour
review: I was actually surprised to see the well appointed rooms which i was told were done up very recently. The hotel is a short walk from the station but if you have a lot of luggage you are better off taking a taxi. Its a nice place to stay for a day or two. Ask for a room facing the tram lines (on the entrance side). There is hardly any traffic on this side, its a lot more quieter as compared to the other side.

title: Not bad for short stay !
review: We were part of an Insight Tour group traveling in Italy for the first time.  Older hotel located near the train station with tram tracks on the front of the hotel.  Had a clean room, decent size although the grout in the handheld shower was dirty.  15 minute walk to the Piazza Publico, 20 to the Duomo, 25 to Uffizi.  One unusual feature was there were no computerized door locks - simply a door key lock.  The key was attached to a heavy weighted metal tassel which you turned in when you left the hotel..  We had a nice view of Florence from the sixth floor (took a picture), wonderful continental breakfast, and free wi-fy (which was very popular).  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Other reviews noted hearing the tram at all hours - we had no problem with noise at all and we faced…

review: PROS: This hotel was fabulous! Very modern and clean, the staff were very helpful and made dinner reservations for us at a restaurant nearby and it was seriously the best meal I've ever had in my life!!!!! Air conditioned, elevators and the breakfast buffet was adequate. The best part was that it was very close to the train station so we could drop our bags quickly. And it had a tv in the bathroom mirror!!! Hahaha we were quite surprised about that one!!  CONS: Our shower leaked, it was fairly new looking, just poor design. That's seriously the only bad thing I can think of, we really loved this hotel.

title: Good Hotel
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel, close to the main train station, for a conference I was attending. Overall, this is an excellent place to stay for those (like us) who needed proximity to this part of Florence (the conference was minutes away by foot). The hotel has one of the best breakfast buffets of any hotel I've stayed at. The room was neither small nor large, just right for a couple. The TV was flat panel and attached to the wall (a mini version was also in the bathroom). When first encountered, the room seemed somewhat bizarre, like a movie director's version of a 22nd-century hotel, with open closets and decor, and a strange-looking bathroom. However, over time (after the first day), everything seemed quite natural and lovely. We had a great view of the city on a…

title: Nice Modern Hotel in the Heart of Florence
review: Nice location, near the railway station, good price, the only negative thing is the sound of tram. The staff is very gentle speaks very good english, the breakfast was quite good.  The staff suggested us a very very good indian restaurant, Haveli ,that is very close to the hotel (2 minutes walking). I suggest this hotel to indian tourists!

title: Pretty bad
review: My boyfriend, Dave and I, Natasha stayed at Hotel Londra in Florence for 2 nights during our Italian vacation.  We chose this hotel due to its central location and close proximity to the Santa Maria Novella Central Train Station and car rental companies.  We arrived to Florence by train and departed by rent-a-car.  The hotel was conveniently located a short (approximately 650 foot) walk from the train station.  Hotel lobby was spacious and modern.  We booked a Classic Double Room, which was nice, clean and comfortable.  The room also had a mini-refrigerator and a balcony with a lovely view.  Room price included an impressive breakfast buffet that included many cold and hot options, juices, coffee selections and even Champagne for your mimosas!  Hotel was located within a walking…

review: First room -very small room -toilet did not work  2nd room better but still very small - single rooms are generally small in Italy. It was clean, bathroom was ok Good buffet breakfast Not good walking area-have to cross some busy streets to get to the center of things

title: Organized tours of 1982 and 2011 landed us here.
review: We booked a modern room based on the pictures they showed on booking.com, hotels.com, venere.com. So when we checked in, we got the shock of our lives when we entered the room on the 5th floor, the room was old, with a gross red dirty carpet. The bed was squeaky and lumpy and the bed covers were old. It also smelled of smoke. When we complained about the room, they told us we didn’t specify about booking that we wanted a new room. Hello, they never showed the old rooms in their website. Apparently half the rooms in the hotel are renovated. But they don’t mention that in their website. We demanded to be transferred to a new but the old man at the reception asked if we were willing to pay? Hello, Pay because we wanted to transfer to a new room which is what we thought we booked in…

title: Decent Hotel
review: In the diary of my TWA tour of 1982, my comment on the Londra was "decent" - that is not a rave review.  An Insight Tour, which generally had us in lovely hotels, booked the Londra as our Florence hotel this year.  A somewhat noisy  city rail system runs right in front of the hotel about every 15 minutes, starting early in the morning and ending at about 11PM. The rooms were seedy, with poor bed linens, a rubber mat between the mattress and bottom sheet, peeling veneers, and a chunk out of the bathroom sink cabinet's MDF for starters.  Insight booked dinner here and it was simply vile with  horrid gray meat - only dessert was edible.  Breakfast was average for tour hotels.  Big heavy tassled keys which you had to leave at the front desk when you left the hotel and retrieve when…

title: Not a Good Choice
review: Located close to the train station so a bit away from the city centre but quite easily accessible. Good breakfast. We were in the "Feeling Design" category of rooms which were spacious,comfortable and modern in design. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

review: I had done my research - and knew that this hotel was not good - but couldn't get Insight tours to allow me to change hotel -  DO NOT STAY HERE - rooms bad, food bad, staff bad. Don't even try to upgrade your rooms - because even that won't even  save you.  But if you do get caught here - please note - no irons or iron boards in the hotel.  Nothing about this hotel is worth saying anything nice about it. What more can I say - but don't stay here

title: A scam, don't trust their website!!!
review: The plus points for our stay were the free WIFI and location of hotel.  We were too tired and fall asleep almost immediately, thus were not disturbed by the trams travelling early or late in the day.  There were a good variety of options for dinner selection in the restaurant. During dinner with our tour, the restaurant staff were unable to differentiate from steak and veal, made blunders serving wrong main courses. This ruins the whole dining experience for some of our tour members.  Shopping for leather goods in Florence is a must with many options from local brands to branded goods.  There are a variety of sight seeing tours in Florence with the churches, excursion to San Gimignano, Basilica of Santa Croce.

title: Good location
review: I booked 3 nights of a triple room, non-smoking with 1 double bed and 1 single bed. On arrival, the room provided a room with an aged room with dirty carpet, broken curtain, the single bed became a sofa bed, LCD in their hotel photos became a 17 inch CRT TV.  The decoration was totally different from the photos.  No air-conditions.  No balcony as mentioned.  Full of smelling of cigar.  We then made complaint at the front desk, the answer we got was that there are so many kinds of rooms in the hotel, they are unable to post all the picture.  The staff didn't helpful and asked me to show her our booking print out to tell her what were going wrong.  After a serious of argue, the staff only arranged another aged room with a single bed instead of sofa bed, with a little balcony, but…

title: Stay away of this one
review: Positives: The room I stayed in was spacious, clean and functional.                    Close to train station and within walking distance to major attractions in                     Florence.                    Lots of restaurants and shops nearby.                    Free internet although a little slow (but can't complain when its free).                    Easy to find hotel.                    Reception staff helpful  Negatives: Shower cubicle was very small and cramped.  There was no soap dish in                     shower cubicle so you end up putting soap on the floor.

title: Great value hotel close to everything
review: We found this hotel easily by following the tramlines from the station. On first impression, we weren't sure about the location, just opposite some unsightly barracks. However once in the room we were delighted. We had asked for a modern room - you can choose traditional as an option. The modern room was minimalist to the extreme. It was impossible to maintain the look once you've unpacked, as storage was exposed. The room came with hairdryer, mini bar, safe (free), tea making facilities and phone. The air-con was disabled, but as the weather was cold outside, this wasn't a problem. In fact the room was always warm when we returned from our travels. Top marks go to the towels and beds. Towels were huge and fluffy and the beds were really comfy with nice linen. I also appreciated…

title: Not very impressive
review: We were impressed by most aspects of this hotel.  It is in an ideal location about 5-10 mins walk to the main attractions.  Our room was a standard double and had a lovely big balcony.  The trams were barely noticeable late at night or early morning - which is when you want quiet (and they were right outside our window) so don't let comments about the trams put you off!  The breakfast choice was plentiful and the dining room was clean and well serviced.  The bar area was also nice although a little pricey (as I guess you would expect!)  We walked everywhere and ate at two lovely restaurants during our stay (Taverna Divina Commedia & Le Antiche Carrozze - both on TripAdvisor)

title: NOISEY due to tram line out the front of the hotel!
review: I stayed at the hotel with a friend in October. We had booked a twin room for €268 for 2 nights. Rooms looked divine on the website.When we arrived they told us they had us in a double, i asked for a twin only to discover the twin had two singles pushed together with one set of linen over them. We went to go for the bigger room and went back to get the double room only to find out the double bed was also two twins pushed together. Rooms are very small. On arrival bed looked messed. We went to make some tea to settle in and the milk tab was opened and used. On telling reception, the person behind reception wasnt to bothered and told me to go to the bar to get more and didnt as much as apologise. Rarely was there staff behind the bar. Food was lovely. Front reception staff were…

title: Nothing Special
review: Fabulous hotel in many ways, location, staff, free internet and great breakfast.  Book online as it is much cheaper - we had one night booked but had a 'walk in'  the week before and paid much more for the same room.

review: I have traveled to many countries and this is the WORST hotel in the World. I found tents in Africe that didnt have the bugs and mildew this place had. Wasnt able to get a refund when we went to another hotel. Should have known when we went to check in and people were leaving that this was a bad place. Staff is unfriendly and unacommidating. DO NOT STAY HERE !!!!!

title: Convenient location makes the Hotel Londra an excellent choice for tourist and business travelers.
review: Cannot understand the positive reviews. Just returned from that hotel. While my room was not the worst (some mold in bathrooms), others in our group had terrible conditions in their rooms.In some rooms, the air-conditioning was turned off at 9. Impossible to sleep with windows open, as this hotel is right next to the train station. Elevators were not clean, rugs in hallways were not pleasant to look at.  I cannot consider this a 4-star hotel, although that is what our tour company listed it as. If you are traveling on your own, double-check the accomodations and try to stay closer to the center of old Florence.

title: Convenient hotel in Florence
review: We stayed at the Hotel Londra in Florence, Italy during a convention taking place at the Fortezza da Basso, and again for one night upon returning from a tour of Tuscany. The hotel is very convenient, within easy walking distance to the convention center and the train station. It is also an easy walk to most of the historical sites in Florence and some pretty good restaurants (seems like all the food and wine in Italy is really good, from the high style to the family style!), cafes, shops, and gelatarias. The street it is located on, Via Jacopo Da Diacceto, is surprisingly peaceful considering how close it is to the major hustle and bustle of the train station. Helpful people who speak several languages in addition to Italian staff the lobby. They do not always answer the phone,…

title: Good hotel for the price we paid
review: The location of the hotel is very convenient as it is close to the Florence S.M.N. train station and the centre of the town. The rooms are comfortable and clean.The internet access is available for free througout the whole hotel. I appreciated that storage for our luggage was provided for free after we checked out from the hotel.  On the other hand, i didn't like that some members of the staff aren't so friendly and helpful when asking questions or information for sth.

title: Not a four-star experience
review: Our room was on 5th floor and I had read previous comments form other travellers who said rooms on 2nd and 5th floor were old, shabby etc and to an extent this was true- the 2nd and 4th floor have been renovated and look much nicer, but our room was  not modern but ok- we had a lovely balcony overlooking Florence and breakfact every morning was good and plentiful.Some of staff were quite surly- we nicknamed one older man grumpy grandad, but this did not spoil anything for us

title: I wish I could give it less than 1*
review: There may be some rooms at the Londra that have been renovated, but the two our party had were not. The lobby is nice, staff is efficient and friendly. Only one of the two tiny elevators works, and it won't move if there are more than 4 people (or 3 heavy ones) in it.  Head up the stairs and you can't miss the horribly stained carpet, the badly scuffed and dinged walls. The carpet in our room was actually threadbare in one place, and wall next to the bathroom stained with watermarks. I could feel the springs in the bed. Otherwise, the room was well-sized, towels were great, maid service thorough. If they'd do some modernizing, I'd feel better about it. Food at breakfast and in restaurant was excellent, but not enough to compensate for the rate paid at this supposedly four-star…

title: Would stay again
review: Stayed here with a Trafalgar Tour.  Our room was TERRIBLE.  Worst in all of Europe.  There was burn marks on the walls, mouldy carpet, broken (and dangerous) powerpoints, smelly couch, hallways (on our level) looked like they were 100 yrs old I could go on. The one positive is that it is pretty close to Florence centre.  After speaking with some other people it appears that some rooms (or floors) have been completely renovated and are immaculate - I did not get one of these.  Make sure you request a renovated room or you will regret it.

title: Nice hotel, if you don't drive and get lost in Florence
review: This hotel was very central, and very close to the train station (about 2 blocks away). Rooms are clean and modern. We asked the bartender for a restaurant recommendation and he suggested Giostra, which was very very good. Overall good notel, although not sure it's a 4 star.

title: Really enjoyed our stay, great location, nice staff...
review: The hotel has nice pictures of it, for sure. It's even rated four star.  BUT IT'S NOTHING LIKE IN THE PICTURES.  Well, there might be floors that are renovated nicely. But the two floors, 3rd and 6th that we saw after booking the hotel through hotels.com for 108 euros/night brought us to an UGLY ROOM that had on old red carpet full of stains... The corridor was even worse: UGLY, OLD, DIRTY, STINKY.  We left the hotel before spending a single night in it. I FELT RIPPED OFF since I know what you can get with that money in Florence. And this was something I would have paid 30-50 euros for, not more.  We were showed a new room which was not better than the first. And only when we said that we leave, we might have got a renovated room. Who knows. But by then we had booked something…

title: Not Four Stars
review: We stayed here for two nights and really liked it.  Excellent location near train station and the center of the city was a 5-10 minute walk.  Good breakfast with lots of choices (eggs, bacon, rolls, etc), room was very clean and modern (our preference), and quiet.  Very nice staff who helped us with lots of questions.  Bar was great, especially the outdoor area.  Very relaxing with realyl good, free appetizers and a very nice bartender.  Was a little expensive, so we bought some beers at the local market and had those in our room while getting ready to go out.  All in all a great hotel!

title: OK Hotel, but wouldn't stay there again
review: The Hotel Londra offers a convenient location across the street from the Florence rail terminal and within walking distance of major churches and museums.  The street on which one enters is unattractive and often deserted, as it is directly across the street from the rail station and a trolley-type train runs on the street.  The ground floor of the hotel is moderately attractive, with a couple of free internet access terminals, a stylish breakfast buffet room (with good food) and a bar.  However, the guest rooms themselves are tiny and rather hideous.  There is no carpeting, and there are no wall hangings.  My bed had two rather flat pillows that needed to be stacked to provide any comfort at all.  The bathroom was too tiny to accommodate a tub, instead there is a very narrow…

title: Great Location and pleasant rooms.
review: Hotel is close to the rail, but more hotels closer to the center of Florence -- it was clean, but not elegant, not a 4 star hotel as represented by AMX.  Breakfast was awesome and the staff very courteous.

title: Outdated and in need of a makeover, close to train station
review: Had a recently remodeled room which was absolutely first rate. Clean elegant design and spacious. Also, a small exterior balcony. Large well appointed bathroom. Knowledgeable and helpful staff. The included breakfast buffet was outstanding. This would clearly be our choice for my next visit to Florence.

title: A Cozy but Freezing Stay for me
review: Our room was a nice size and quite spacious with a nice big and comfy bed, however the room couldve done with a good clean to remove the marks from the walls etc. The devore was outdated and in need of an upgrade. There was a very nice bar with freefood during happy hour and there was a nice and very extensive buffet breakfast

title: close to train station, but otherwise lacking
review: Hotel Londra is located near to St. Maria Train Station. It took about 5 mins walk from there, hence making it an ideal hotel for me to stay in as I would be moving on to the next city in Italy afer a few days. In addition, it was also more convenient for me since I would need to take a train to visit the Leaning Tower of Pisa.   The hotel is designed and furnished modernly. The hotel staff were friendly. I remembered I checked out a day earlier without knowing I have made an error in my schedule, but a hotel staff informed me after checking and I stayed for another day without moving on to the next city . Many Thumbs up for that!  The hotel room I stayed in was spacious and cozy. Basic amenities were provided in the room. There was also free unlimited Wireless Internet Service…

title: nice room with excellent breakfast
review: Stayed at Hotel Londra in April 2010 as part of a business trip.  Although the hotel is not pretty from the outside the staff & rooms were exceptional.  Also the location can't be beaten, 2 minutes from the main train station, 1 minute from a couple of supermarkets and only about 5 minutes from the centre of town.  I would recommend this hotel to all visitors.

title: Beter look for something else
review: location - easy to find yet close to SMN train station. breakfast - provide variety range of food. Many chooices

title: Pleasant hotel within walking distance of shops and places of interest
review: I had to stay for one week in Florence, business trip. The Hotel is not in te center of Florence but close enough to have a nice little walk in to the Old town. The room they gave me was last floor, last room at the end of he floor. The room was dirty, especially the carpet. The bed was a kind of IKEA emergency sofa. The view out of the window was prison like. The breakfast was bad. The food quality acceptable but the tiny room for the breakfast was overcrowded and you had to wait your turn until there was a free table. The reason is the half of the table are reserved for traveler groups which are carried n with buses. The dinner in the hotel is good quality for a acceptable price. The have a nice garden where you can have a drink after dinner which was the only plus of this…

title: BE prepared for small surprises!
review: I stayed here twice last year for business. The hotel is clean and modern with pleasant staff and good service. The breakfast buffet was not the best I have had, but there was quite a good choice. The food in the restaurant was nice but I didn't think the choice of snacks in the bar was sufficient.   The hotel is close to the train station and a short journey from the airport. Many of the main tourist attractions are within 10-20 minutes walk away and the shops are also close by. They were in the process of laying tram lines in front of the hotel so I'm not sure how this will affect the noise levels when complete.

title: Close to train station. FREE INTERNET is a big plus
review: I was initially not impressed with the location of the hotel as it is out of the way from most tourist sites, but later realized the hotel is situated within walking distant to the bus stop and train station.   The lobby of the hotel is dated, but the room (I booked a Design Room) is clean and looks just like the photo on their site.  There are, however, issues with the room.  The walls and ceiling are paper thin - we heard ladies walking around in their high heeled shoes from the floor above.  The construction of the bathtub had problems and water seeped from under the tube.  Recommend you stay here if you need to hit the train or bus station early.  Free Wifi is a great plus.

title: 4 stars? I think not...
review: Staff is professional and helpful. Gym with sauna feels great after cold and snowy days seeing the sites. Hotel restaurant is expensive but Very local trattorias nearby. Clean, well heated, comfortable. Breakfast was extensive with options of fresh bread, scrambled eggs, American bacon or Italian pancetta/sausage, three types of juices, asti spumante if you want mimosas, cakes, pasteries and creme caramel, yogurt,cereals, coffee/ tea. I will stay here again.

title: Worse hotel ever, terrible service
review: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a tour group and cannot say that I will stay here again. Front desk service was hit and miss - on our arrival I noticed that there was free wifi and requested the password. The response I got was a very curt "Come back later, we are very busy". As I was travelling alone, I was accommodated in a very small single room and found myself with a bed without blankets. When I requested for one, one was promptly sent to my room, only to discover traces of hair throughout it! Breakfast was ok and the hotel is close to the train station if you are looking to do some short trips - I recommend a day trip to the medieval town of San Gimingiano which boast the best gelato in the world! There is also a good restaurant called Ristorante Belcore about 5-10mins…

title: Comfortable, accommodating, helpful staff, good location
review: Perfunctory service at best, bordering on surly. Incompetent front desk. Terrible service, almost caused us to miss our flight. The message light on room telephone was flashing. I asked the front desk how to retrieve the message (there were no instructions in the room on how to retrieve messages, or for that matter, how to even reach the front desk). His reply was that the telephone message service in the hotel did not work. I asked him if I had any messages; he said no. I asked again to be sure, and he he replied with a condescending "no messages". My girlfriend got hold of a different staff member who told her the messages did work, and told her how to retrieve them. Turns out we had 3 messages from the airlines informing of a change in the flight time.  I had also asked the…

title: Excellent
review: Have recently returned from a week long trip to Florence.  Had pre-paid for Hotel Londras based upon the reviews here and regretted it from day 1.  Reception staff was unhelpful and fairly miserable.  Had asked the concierge for advice regarding areas for shopping and was told to go 'downtown like the other tourists' Hotel staff were very rude, short and always seemed miserable.  Hotel does not provide irons in the rooms, and do not have the value-added basic facilities such as a plug convertor - was told 'we just dont provide them'.  Hotel is near to the station, but a fair walk to the middle of the tourist attractions.  Would never stay here again.

title: Bad Customer service
review: Very nice hotel, excellent service, friendly staff. Well located in the center of Florence. We enjoyed our stay immensely thanks to the staff.

title: Modern but Comforable
review: I had booked 2 rooms for an overnight stay in Florence. When the valet took me and my husband into our room the curtain was hanging off the rail making the room look shabby in the least. However, he said right away that the hotel knew about it and it would be fixed soon.  After our afternoon in Florence I returned to the hotel and the curtain was not yet fixed. On leaving the hotel for the evening I went to reception to tell them about the curtain and the receptionist snapped at me that they knew about the curtain and it would get fixed. He then asked if someone could go to our room and fix it then. I said yes of course. When we returned after dinner, the curtain had still not been fixed. It never was during our whole stay. A luxury design hotel??

title: Great base for exploring Florence and the surrounds
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to put your comments on the Trip Advisor website following your recent stay at Hotel Londra in Florence. We are terribly sorry to learn of your disappointment with your stay here. We looked into the issues you have raised and me, together with all the staff are sincerely apologizing for this untypical lapse of customer service.  We usually receive an excellent feedback from our clients as customer satisfaction and service are our main goal, but constructive criticism is welcomed  as it enables us to make improvements and provide even a higher standard of service that our guests expect from us.  I strongly trust that a future stay in our hotel will restore your faith in us,   Best Regards,  Antonio Dondiego General Manager  Hotel Londra-Florence

review: This hotel was really excellent. The room was comfortable, the public areas pleasant, and the breakfasts excellent. The staff were very friendly, too. Location ideal especially if travelling by train as we were.

title: need to try harder
review: We were lucky to get a room on the second floor where the rooms were newly refurbished and very clean. We had heard that other floors had older rooms which were very tired and not so clean. Beds very comfortable and clean. Shower was rather small but there was plenty of hot water and plenty of towels.  Breakfast was fresh with a good variety, I have had a lot worse in Italy!   Our meal in the hotel restaurant on our first night was very disapponting and quite expensive but we were more than happy with the selction of fabulous places to eat in Florence. Expensive, yes but it's Florence after all. Cover charges tend to bump up the bill as you pay premium for sitting outside restuarants.  We went to Gilli's and had a hot choclate, this is a must when visiting Florence. Pure thick…

title: Ok but not 4 star (plus horrible smell in the bathroom)
review: we managed to be moved to a newly refurbished room after spending 1 night in one of the old dingy ones. ultra mod and very good. tea making facilities but a reluctance to give you any tea or milk! i think that there will be noise issues when all the rooms are refurbished as there are no floor coverings and we had a couple of nights listening to our neighbours above pacing the room, also they are relaying tram lines outside at the front of the hotel! the staff seemed particularly unfriendly and only spoke when spoken to. breakfast ok but nothing special. florence is wonderful but a total rip-off like most european cities now. (£6 coffee & £10 beer in the hot spots) and nowhere to sit except the churches which now charge an entrance fee!

title: Brilliant Hotel!
review: Stayed here at the beginning of July 09 with my girlfriend.  The hotel is no more than a 5 minute walk from the station (ideal if you want to catch the early train to Pisa/ Siena/ Airport) and probably a 10-15 min walk to the Duomo.  The room we stayed in was modern, clean and spacious.  The major let down was the bathroom - horrible foul sewer smell was constant whenever you went in there (I think the designer had decided to put the sewer vent for all the bathrooms above into here and not bothered with any air circulation in the bathroom!)    For a budget hotel right next to the train station and a place to rest your head, it is ok.  Probably would look elsewhere next time.

title: Interesting....
review: I stayed together with my wife and child for  three nights at Hotel Londra, and I must say that I found the hotel friendly and extremely comfortably  for who travels with children. The room was very clean, large enough for three persons and tastefully decorated; At breakfast you can expect a large variety of food, fruit and juice in a very nice presentation, so prepare for an exquisite quality breakfast! It will surely be our first choice when we come back to Florence again, I strongly recommend it.

title: Consistently solid value
review: As someone said earlier,  half of the hotel has been renovated and the other half has not.  It is pot luck as to which room you will receive upon check-in.  The first room we were assigned had not been renovated.  The furnishings were shabby and obviously very used and NOT picturecd on the website.  We had a triple room with a king and the extra bed was a pull-out twin sofa that was very uncomfortable, with the middle bar and springs poking into your back.  We immediately requested another room with a more confortable bed and were shown another similar room with the same quality bed.  We were told by the front desk manager that an updated room would be availabe the next day, so we opted to stay where we were for the night.  The next day we asked for the updated room and were…

title: Relaxing hotel with good rooms
review: I have stayed at the Londra several times over the last 10 years. I keep going back because it consistently delivers good service, a great breakfast buffet and convenient location near the railroad station.

title: Worst Hotel of Tour
review: We went to Florence due to our friends getting married there. We picked the Londra as it has recently been revamped and its close to the station. We were coming from Pisa and heading to Rome so this was a factor. Our room was large and airy and light. We had a small balcony which you could stand out on but we didnt use it. Florence was very hot -32 degrees C- so we were glad that the air-con was so good. the staff on reception were very friendly too.  There is a lovely outside terrace behind the restaurant and bar where you can have a drink on the low sofas and chill out. We always came down for a drink here at the end of the day. We also had a drinks reception for our friends who were getting married here and it was the perfect location. Breakfast was very good with a great…

title: Good location, perfectly clean room
review: Just back from 2 nights at the hote londra.  We really enjoyed this hotel.  Free internet and decent breakfast.  The hotel was more modern than some we stayed in our trip. Great location to all site and walking distance to the train station.  There was some construction during our stay outside the hotel but it did not bother us at all.  The guest room was well appointed and the largest out of the 4 we stayed in on our trip.    For sight seeing we used the sightseeing florence double decker bus, they sold tickets at the hotel.  This is a great way see the city sites and you can get on and off at any locations.  Tickets are good for two days.  We also received a 10% discount off our next tour in rome with the same company if you save you ticket/receipt.  Hotel had at great little…

title: GD location, nicely decorated room
review: After being in Rome and living for a few days in a hotel room with 6" of walking space between the bed and the wall, this was a breath of fresh air.  The room was very spacious- I could have done a cartwheel in there if I wanted to!  The modern decor was also very simple and pleasing to the eye.  My mom and I stayed here for just a couple days to do some wine-tasting and tour the Boboli gardens.  The breakfast was also very good, with both warm food and lots of fresh fruit.  Altogether a wonderful stay.  The only complaint I had was that it's very close to the train station and the vagrants that wander around nearby.  At night it was not the kind of place I would venture out all alone, that's for sure!  Otherwise it was only a 2 second walk to the trains if you need to go…

title: Nice location and great breakfast
review: pros:  1) very close to the train station. In florence, I think that's what you want THE MOST, because dragging the luggage is the most painful thing and if your mode of transport is train, then it makes it very convinient. The walk to  the Duomo is around 10 minutes. The walk to Santa Croce is around 20minute. Bus Station close by that will take you to Piazza Michangelo. 2) newly decorated. very nice interior, although the TV is still the old one. 3) free internet  cons:  two problems I had. 1) the shower hose's strength is so weak. 2) wifi internet does not support the iphone nor apple machines.

title: Excellent Hotel
review: Stayed here with my wife on our Honeymoon for about 5 days.  The hotel could not be closer to the train staion unless it was inside the station.  This is a good and bad thing.  Given that the center of Florence is relatively small and the station is there it makes a nice location but at night its quiet and partially dark.  There were renovations on the streets when we were there which made for an unpleasant smell and scene.  The room was the smallest of all we had relating to Venice, Rome and Positano.  The bathroom definitely was nothing to discuss as it was a small closet like with such a small bathtub with no curtain that the whole bathroom basically flooded after showering.  The best thing about the hotel was the lobby and breakfast.  The lobby was spacious and modern.  The…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Hotel Londra is an excellent choice for every tourist that arrives in Florence either for business or for pleasure. I stayed just a weekend but the hotel, the facilities they offered and nevertheless the personnel, really made my stay in Florence a perfect one: it is strategically located near the  central Train Station and  the center of the town, rooms are modernly decorated with an Italian eye for every detail: the buffet breakfast was extremely rich, satisfying all tastes (as we arrived late, we also stayed for dinner at the Hotel's restaurant, great by the way!!!!). So, when planning your trip to Florence, keep in mind this hotel tip!!!

title: Problems....
review: we spent 3 days at hotel Londra in Florence and it was wonderful. First of all, we very appreciated the prompt and friendly check-in. The room was spacious, modern, clean and very comfortable. It had a lovely bathroom with spacious bathtub. The bed was really comfortable and we both slept very well. We would fully recommend this hotel and want to go back again!

title: deception!!! Joke!!!
review: The hotel is central, walking distance to city centre and trains, has tea and instant coffee making, fairly good breakfast but....  *Coffee or tea in dining room is the worst I have ever had. *Hotel is tired and desperate for refurbishing and a slap of paint. *Non smoking rooms stink of cigarette. *Renovations on 4th floor reverberates throughout the building and construction was directly below our room. Having an afternoon nap is out of the question; a BIG problem if you encounter jet lag.  *Heating was way too hot even after we requested they turn it OFF. We either had to sleep with verandah door/window open to let in cool air (it was 5 degrees outside) or toss and turn on top of bedding. The traffic and sirens kept us awake if we left the door/window open.  *Cheaper same…

title: very nice hotel
review: This hotel is a JOKE!  The hotel website is misleading. It shows pictures of rooms that are nice and cosy. The reality is that the 2nd floor only complies with the pictures displayed on the website. the other floors (most of hotel rooms) are old and the lobbies are sometimes dirty.   The hotel staff is nice but it is not the solution to a bad room.  The hotel bar is nice.  The fist night I ve stayed there, the hotel had no hot water!!! It is was due to an accident but nobody tried to compensate it by any means.

review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. title: Comfortable room
review: This hotel was a great find.  For 115 euros a night (probably partly because we went during the off season) we stayed for three nights.  Clean, modern, spacious and newly renovated.  Huge by Italian standards.   It's a bit of a walk (15 minutes) to the absolute center where the Campanille and other sites are.   But extremely convenient if you're traveling by train.  The breakfast was great--even had some american breakfast fare which was a nice break from the typical Italian breakfast pastries and fruit.   The staff was extremely helpful and always willing to call a cab or provide more information about tours in Florence and the amount of time it would take to get from place to place.  We had already picked out restaurants from our guide book so I'm not sure how their…

title: Really good for sightseeing base
review: I stayed in Florence in this hotel with two other friends. The room was big enough such that the three of us were perfectly comfortable in there, which is not always the case when you get a triple room, so I was very pleased. The room was nicely decorated and the people in the reception were helpful.  If you decide to stay in this hotel I highly recommend that you stop by the bar at night, specially if you go there during the summer. It is a great place to have a drink, talk and relax after a day of walking arounf beautiful Florence. It is very nice and cool place to hang out.

title: Close to Railway station
review: This hotel was much better than we expected after reading some of the reviews.  It was within walking distance to everything.  The breakfast was great, and reception area was nice.  Room was fairly basic but spotless and had everything we needed.  Great to use as a base.

title: Worst hotel we stayed in Italy
review: Used this hotel for business at the end of Sept.  5 minute walk from the Santa Maria Novella Railway station, and about a 10 minute walk from the city centre. Comfortable rooms, good size, but perhaps a little tired in places. Very quiet (even though they are building a tram system outside), and an excellent breakfast. Generally, this is a pretty good hotel, and fairly good value for money.

review: it's very close to stazione centrale, but nowadays there is a road shift in the area. so workmen are excavating all around the hotel... a bit noisy... however, hotel is nice, have clean and confortable rooms. if you find a 120euro/room deal, it's worth to stay... p.s. it's 10 minutes walk to Duomo and palazzo vecchio...

title: Not  a good hotel
review: We booked into this hotel  last minute after a bad experience at another and found it to be welcoming, fresh and clean, very good customer service, some nice views of Florence and a comfortable bed and room with decent breaksfast. Good value for money.

title: Excellent Hotel!!!
review: Checked into the hotel from the very close train station with a semi-friendly staff.  Got a super small room on the 1st floor right next to the elevator.  The bed was right up against the wall we barely had room to move around.  We did like that the hotel offers free internet access which was the only hotel on our trip that did.  We accepted are small room until we found ants by the window, desk, and on our pillows and bedframe.  We complained although it was late at night.  A maintenance person came in and sprayed ant spray and had to wait for the fumes to go away. In addition, the air conditioning was horrible and had a warm room the the mist of a hot sumer in Florence.  The next morning, the hotel did re-assign us to a renovated room on the top floor with a balcony to make up…

title: Londra was good value
review: My husband & I just came back from vacation in Europe which included five nights at Hotel Londra.  This hotel is closed to the Santa Maria de la Novella train station.  This hotel offers everything you need when you are on vacation, from breakfast, bar, and inside restaurant.  The concierge staff was very courteous and helpful.  They helped us in selecting where to dine and how to go around the city.  Our room was very clean and spacious!!! The hotel also has a back patio where you can relax, have some cocktails and listen to the music.  The patio has lots of trees which allows for a nice breeze although this time of the year is very hot and humid.  I will definetely stay at this hotel again!!! I will greatly recommend this hotel to my friends and also to anybody looking for…

title: No Air conditioning, grouchy staff
review: I trawled hotel websites for days after booking our Ryanair flights to Florence. We finally settled on the Hotel Londra after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I really wanted a room with a balcony with a nice view, and in fairness this is what we got. The view from our balcony was gorgeous but there is no furniture so you need to drag the chairs from the room out onto it. They really need to think about sweeping or mopping the balcony floor tiles as they were pretty filthy.  Our main gripe with the hotel Londra was the room. After all our research I really wanted to open the door to the room and be pleased, unfortunately our room, 507, hadn't been decorated since the eighties. A highly patterned carpet, floral chintzty wallpaper, net curtains and twin beds is not what is…

title: Very nice hotel, conveniently located in Florence
review: The hotel's air conditioning does not work.  The rooms are hot and small.  The front desk staff is not particularly friendly.  They know that the hotel AC does not work and they try to shrug off requests and complaints.  We had one of the renovated rooms, but the AC still did not work.  Also, no laundry service from Saturday until Monday.  I would not rate the hotel at 4 stars.

title: Londra Hotel - Great Stay & Very Kid Friendly
review: We just stayed one night mid-July and we loved it; the hotel location is quite convenient, close to the station and walking distance from the historic center. ( The only "bad" thing is the road works being done right now in the area.) Room was clean and bright with a tub in the bathroom. The "Japanese" looking patio was so pretty at night with the lights and nice music, we had a drink there late at night. Staff was very helpful. We do recommend and would go back there for sure during another trip in Tuscany.

title: Repeat Visit
review: During our recent trip to Italy, among the hotels we stayed at, Londra was the best. Coming from the states, where finding a hotel with large rooms or suites, which can accomodate two very active little girls and us, is so easy, it was a shocker to us at the first hotel we stayed in Bergamo, when they mentioned that we need two rooms for four of us. It didnt matter the children were 5 year and 9 months old. We had to fight tooth and nails to get a one big room with a King size bed and a crib(our own portable one that we bought). We had to pay extra 60 euros a night for that arrangement.   I was expecting the same kind of argument when we checked into Londra, but to our surprise, there were no issues & on the contrary, everyone was very nice & the rooms were amazing with every…

title: Really Nice
review: DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE THIS!!!  This hotel does not have working air-conditioning.  We were traveling with 2 other couples and all three rooms were the same... very hot!  The pictures on the website only reflect the most expensive room in the hotel.  The other rooms are outdated and old!  The bar area outside is nice but doesn't make your stay more comfortable.  For the price, not a good value!

title: Excellent Bar abd Restaurant
review: Great hotel.Nice,clean rooms,comfortable beds,big bathrooms.The stuff was kind and helpful and the breakfast pretty nice.Great location near the Santa Maria Novella railway station.Don't miss this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Would go back again to Hotel Londra, Florence
review: This was an extremely quiet hotel with the best restaurant and Bar I have been in. The Bar Captain Gino was a gem who spoke perfect English and was an entertainer and perfect mine host.  The Canapés and hordure’s offered from the bar prior to dinner were 2nd to none.  My only complaint is that the Hotel is not close to restaurants and whilst the station is close it is a difficult walk with luggage if you have hip or knee problems.  All up the staff were very friendly and if I had a bar in Australia I would hire Gino, today. He would make a perfect replacement for Eddie at the Old Chevron at Kings Cross.

title: A great find
review: Stayed at Hotel Londra at end of April 2008 and was a great experience.  Just a block from SMN train station which is very convenient.  We requested and received a renovated room.  The room was quite spacious, large king size bed with dark wood furniture; small refrigerator.  Shower facility was very nice and bathroom was big.  Everything you needed was in the room.  Staff was very friendly and informative.  Full breakfast was good. Lots to choose from.  If you do not like the coffee served, then just request another type - we drank cappuchino. We did not smell any odors as previous review stated.  Center of Florence is very small and you can walk everywhere.  Suggest the double decker tour bus (jump on and off different sites) from the front of the train station.  Booked two…

title: lovely stay in Florence
review: We were seven -- five adults and two small (aged 3 and 5) children, meeting from various parts of the world to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary.  The reception desk was efficient and friendly, and helped us all through our 9-day stay with advice and information.  The rooms are a bit small but adequately sized, and spotlessly clean.  Breakfast is magnificent -- and when we didn't like the samovar coffee they brought us espresso on request.  The location, though not in the center of the old city, is certainly walking distance from all of the main sights, and practically next door to both bus and train stations.  Work going on in the street didn't bother us.  Our only complaint was over a slight mixup in the reservations, which was straightened out later.  Highly recommended!

title: Nice hotel in a not so nice part of Florence
review: Very Good Choice   The hotel Londra is a very convenient hotel for ashort break in Florence.   We booked 2 nights in Booking website and we found a modern and lovely room, spacious bathroom as in room images. We had dinner atthe hotel restaurant and we appreciated the great food and the polite staff.   We recommend the Hotel Londra to all travellers in Florence.

title: Horrible!
review: I am giving this hotel a 3/5 rating because of what it offered inside the hotel. The location took off 2 stars from it being a perfect hotel to stay at while visiting Florence. We got one of the new superior rooms which was just beautiful. Big room with high ceilings, large windows, big comfy bed and  nice laminate wood floors.       Definitely request a superior double when booking because this hotel is undergoing a new look and some of the old double rooms look very dated and worn out. We booked through hotwire and got a great deal and then emailed the hotel and requested the superior room. They replied back and said for $25 extra per night I could upgrade, which is well worth it when you see the difference between an old room and a new room. Just look at previous reviews for…

title: Pretty Decent Stay At the Hotel Londra, Would Go Back.
review: The pictures of the hotel on the website are taken from the new rooms, most of the hotels rooms are old, SMELLY, Moldy, small, and dirty! BEWARE!  I asked to be changed twice to two different rooms. The first room was the smallest room I have ever seen in my life- like a closet with a twin bed it in. It had mold everywhere, and everything in the room was old and distroyed!  The second room has a single bed in it and the room only fit around the bed. The rooms and the hallways smelled so bad I had to close my nose, it smelled of mold and sweat! I also heard people having sex all through the night. Also, one of the men that worked there left me a love note- which freaked me out because they had been in my room ( who knows doing WHAT!)  The third room was had two beds in it and was…

title: Quite Dissapointed
review: We booked 2 triple rooms during the busy December period and got a reasonably good price. The location is excellent in terms of distance to the train station although it would've been slightly better if it were more centrally located in relation to places to see in Florence. However, as these sights are very close to each other, none of them is more than a 15 minute walk from the hotel, which in good weather, is a breeze. Only one other complaint that while we stayed there, there were some road works going on in front of the hotel.  Apart from this, the hotel was excellent - large spacious rooms, clean and large bathrooms, lots of choice on TV, attentive service at both the front desk and in the rooms, free internet access (via which we were able to select different restaurants…

title: Great hotel
review: I had 3 problems with this hotel: location, location and location!  Sure it's only less than a mile away from most attractions.  Relatively speaking though, that's still FAR considering you could get other hotels that are more centrally located for probably half the price!     Also, I don't agree for this hotel to be a 4-star.   Maybe back in the 80's but certainly not in today's standards!   My reasoning as follows:   1) We were given a non-smoking room which is what we asked for.  However, smoke still seeped through the vents from other rooms and I could not sleep for the 1st night.   2) I almost  burned my hand from the hair dryer which didn't have a handle and got so hot.  3)  There was somebody else's hair on our bed.   4) We were given a room with a private balcony (I'm…

title: Best hotel ever!
review: I spent a long weekend with my wife in this hotel. Everything was great, room was really nice and comfortable, staff polite and helpful satisfying all our request. Breakfast was delicious ( I really appreciated the wide range of italian´s cakes). We also had a so good dinner in one of hotel´s restaurants. I advise this hotel even for a long stay.

title: I'd come back to this hotel anytime.
review: I stayed at this hotel with my father, and we both loved the hotel! Rooms were fantastic, but when we ordered twin beds we got a shared bed. This was no problem, and the maid took care of it at the moment, and we got our twin beds in few minuttes! The breakfast was LOVLEY!!! huge dining room, with amazing food! Very good! The only negative thing with the hotel was the placement..it was to far from the central of Florence, but for us it was perfect beacuse we traveled with train, and the train station was few meters away! But for people who would like to go out dining in the evening it was a little bit to far, or mabye it was just us beeing lazy! hehe! anyway i recommend this hotel for everyone!!! It was AMAZING!

title: Courteous staff, great hotel for a family
review: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Perillo Tour.  The hotel has renovated and unrenovated rooms.  Even though Perillo guests are suppose to be in the renovated rooms, our first room was unrenovated - peeling wallpaper, mold on the walls, cruddy bathroom, etc.  It took several calls with the hotel manager and our tour director to get the room changed.     The renovated room was very nice - hardwood floors, new bedding, good bathroom, wall unit for clothes, etc.  This is the room they picture on the website.  Make sure you get a renovated room as the old rooms are not tolerable.  The hotel's location is far from the sites and shopping that Florence is famous for.  The area that the hotel is located in is seedy at best.  It took close to an hour to walk to the center of Florence…

title: Disappointed
review: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Londra.  We booked a triple and a double room.  Both rooms were modern, spacious and clean.   The hotel staff were friendly and courteous.  They give you a half hour free internet service in the lobby.  Breakfast was plentiful enough to start our day of sightseeing.  The hotel was about a 4 minute walk from the Central Train Station .  It is about a 20 minute walk to the central part where the Duomo is located.  We didn't mind the walk  to see the Academia Museum,  the Ponte Vecchio Bridge and Baptistry.  We enjoyed our stay and seeing the beautiful sites of Florence.

title: excellent beds
review: My husband booked this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. On arrival we are hugely disappointed with our bedroom.  The decor was awful, green and rust colours and overall very grim with twin beds. There are road works directly outside on the road, and the hotel had left a note to apologise in the room (we would have hoped to have been informed about this when booking) but it was not what my husband expected when booking having reviewed their website for €200 a night. Having spoken to the reception desk we were informed they were fully booked however when we returned later we asked again and were moved to a better room but still not what we had envisaged. The location is very good and the breakfast selection and outside area great.  We can only hope in time that all…

title: Londra Florence - great hotel, would recommend
review: Stayed there while attending a congress at Firenze Fiera, Piazza Adua.It´s 10 mins walk to the venue, 10 mins to city centre. Quiet, clean, cool rooms, very good, big beds.Huge breakfast buffet, eggs bacon, bread, fruit, cereals etc. - and Spumante !! Coffee from dispenser pretty awful- ask for a cup of cappucino instead.Friendly staff.Garden, bar - very well kept. Fitness room clean, not big - but sufficient. Expensive dinner restaurant- walk to nearby restaurants instead. General advice: Book 4 days ahead online for the Uffizi and see Botticelli´s wonderful paintings without queueing all day.

title: Nice hotel
review: It was an ok hotel, the rooms were soo small, but the breakfast was good and they gave you free internet.  They were having construction outside so that ruined the look a bit and it was dusty outside and i found the cleaning service to be horrible, there were ants everywhere and they never recharged out toilet paper when we obviously needed some. It wasn't like that in my parents room so it depends where your room is but seeing ants everywhere really makes you sick.  Apart from it was in an amazing location you could easily walk everywhere from that point i dont think i will stay there again but it was a good experience

title: Great Little Boutique Hotel!
review: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Hotel Londra. It is situated about 5 minutes walk from the station on the side away from the main tourist areas. The main tourist area in Florence is fairly compact so as long as you are fit, it could still be reached on foot in about 20 minutes. Guests appeared to be mixture of business travellers and tourists.  Breakfast was excellent. Choice on offer was vast, including a couple of hot dishes, typically  sausages and scrambled egg. Well staffed and staff were very efficient in bringing coffee and clearing the tables.  Each evening, we ate in the very nice modern hotel restaurant. This is glass fronted on one side looking out onto a patio area with comfortable couches. It was very pleasant to sit outside there after our evening meal.   There…

title: A little bit expensive but nice
review: The Hotel Londra is a beautiful little hotel with great accommodations, excellent service by the hotel staff, and the best dinner that we had in Italy was at the restaurant in this Hotel.  Breakfast is served each morning, with a generous choice of bakery, meat, egg, fruit, and drink choices.  While the location is a bit of a walk from the center of town, we enjoyed walking and seeing the community every bit as much as we enjoyed all of the historic sites.  Our room was clean, spacious, and we enjoyed a magnificent view which was perfect at sunset.  We will definitely stay at the Hotel Londra the next time we are in Florence.

title: Regular Hotel better for Business Travelers
review: Stayed for a few days for a business trip. The room is a little bit expensive but nice (stayed at 5th floor, nice view of the city). Old furniture, looks cozy. I'm an European so I would've preffered the new floor (3rd I think) which is newly refurbished but modren. Keep that in mind when booking.  Very nice breakfast, polite staff, free Internet. Had problems with Internet in one of the rooms (we had two), staff was didn't succed to fix it before we figure it out to use the other room's....  Location is good, only 10-15 min from the Dome and it's not a crowded area. The only disadvantage is the railway that affects your walk a little bit. Area is clean for a railway station (compared to Paris for example)...

title: Would highly recommend! Great value!
review: We stayed here 3 nights at the end of June 07.  Close to train station, but a bit of a walk from major attractions, not more than 20 minutes. Lovely entrance, dining area and bar.  Very boutique hotel feel.  Free internet.  First room offered was older room that was not renovated and not the one seen on travel web-sites.  We ask to change room and we did.  The room was a bit smaller but very modern, clean lines. Breakfast was good, with many choices.  Staff was so-so.  A bit snobby and not very helpful. I learned that they cater to alot of business people.  For example, I contacted them by email a week in advance in order to make a reservation at the Uffizi on a certain date.  Their responses were few and far between.  I only learned as I got to the hotel that they were…

title: Horrible in almost every way
review: This hotel was a haven during our hot and frenetic race through Italy. We stayed June 24th for 1 night. We booked a triple room through Yahoo travel for $173.   Our room was huge with the third person being accommodated on a fold-out sofa/couch. It was cool (very welcome on this hot day), and the breakfast was amazing. They had everything and our service was excellent. Also, check-out wasn't until noon so we could site-see in the morning and return for our bags before catching an afternoon train.   I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Florence and want to be near the train station. We were able to walk to all sights easily (even when I wasn't feeling well).  I had a hard time finding anything reasonable for our dates. This was the most reasonable on Yahoo travel…

title: Hotel Londra: hit-and-miss.
review: I stayed at this hotel for only one night and it was a truly terrible experience.  I am a very undemanding person and don't require a whole lot from a hotel other than a decent, quiet place to sleep.  I don't need room service or someone to take my bags up for me...just somewhere to sleep.   The front desk staff was rather rude and always acted put-out at the slightest request...such as a map or directions.  The room was pretty decent but you could hear EVERYthing from the surrounding rooms.  I could literally hear the man next door snoring and the woman on the other side screaming during her sexual endeavors.  The bed was also rather uncomfortable, I woke up with back issues for the first time in a long time.      The room cost me almost $400 and because it was a last minute…

title: Okay accomodation, inconvenient location
review: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days this June.  Room: very, very small, including the shower; however, it was brand-new and nicely furnished.  Breakfast: good selection, but the service was hit or miss.  The reception team and concierge were great every time.  Location: away from every attraction, but close to the train station.  Overall, the hotel is a bit pricey, but nice.

title: Good Value, Great People
review: Service dates:  4/27 - 4/30  2007  Good accommodations and a helpful staff.  The rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet (and the room it was served in) was superior.  A four star in Europe but a three star in the US.  The major issue we had with this hotel was its location.  Convenient to the train station but VERY far from central Florence.  No restaurants within walking distance (cabs were required whenever a venture into Florence was undertaken), construction on the main street outside the hotel was in progress, and the neighborhood was less than one would like when on vacation.

title: Massive room, central location
review: Great Value for the money... close to the rail station.  Hotel staff from the wait staff to management were very kind and helpful.  We had our 6mo. old with us and they had prepared the room with bassinet without being asked to.  I'm impressed.

title: Great  lovely hotel, Great location, Highly recommended
review: Central location near the main train station, although not with good views of Florence sights. But easy to get to these from the hotel - 10 minute walk to the Duomo.  The bedroom was huge, and plainly decorated, and the bathroom was also very big.  The breakfast was excellent, with a lot of choice.   The hotel hosts a lot of business events.  There is currently building work going on at the end of the corridor on the second floor, so probably best to avoid this part of the hotel for a while.

title: Very Good Hote
review: We are just back from our trip to Italy, This was our third time in Italy, since I love this country, I chose Hotel Londra because of good reviews I read in Tripadvisor and for it's closeness to the train station and all city attractions. Hotel Londra in Florence is a very good hotel, near the main train station (Santa Maria Novella). We had asked for a triple room, Our room was a very comfortable one with clean and comfortable beds and a modern and clean bath, you could make tee or coffee in the room with diferent choices of tee and cofees put in the room free of charge.you could also have access to high speed internet either in your room or in the lobby, of cource free of charge. Front desk staff were very kind and friendly and they spoke a fluent English, They were very…

title: Conveniently located, suitable for small conferences and workshops
review: Santa Maria Novella train station welcomes the majority of the people arriving in Florence, which might explain the hectic pace. Commuters and tourists come across the constant hustle and bustle of the station before exiting, taking a few steps and stopping amazed in Piazza di Santa Maria Novella. It is impossible not to admire the the square, housing one of the most charming basilicas in Florence. The area has plenty of local spots to taste Tuscan specialties, but don’t stop in the main streets alone; the narrower side streets always ensure satisfaction. The huge Parco Delle Cascine provides a solution to the need for a green area as well as a historic welcome in the form of a bronze statue of King Vittorio Emanuele II riding a horse.

title: Nice stay
review: The hotel Londra is very nicely located near to the Central Rail Station and easy to reach when coming from different places in Italy. Also, it is on a walking distance from most interesting to view points in Florence. Therefore, it is ideal for combining working and tourist goals during the same stay in Florence.  The hotel provides nice conference rooms and accompanying facilities, well equipped with necessary technical stuff.  The personnel is well trained and can support such organization in many details. Thus, I sincerely recommend this hotel for organization of workshops and small conferences due to nice atmosphere and good facilities.

title: Lavish Breakfast and lovely lobby
review: We stayed in Firenza at this hotel and we liked it well. It is not very central but we could reach everywhere in town just by walking. It is near the railway station and bus station that come from Pisa airport. So the location is very nice, the rooms are big and clean and quiet. The staff is also nice.

title: One caution...
review: A group of 7 people recently visit Italy.  We stayed in three rooms:  2 doubles and 1 triple.  We arrived at the train station and easily walked to the Hotel Londra.  Even though it was near the train station the street that the hotel is on was very quiet.  The lobby of the hotel is very nice with leather sofas.  We were shown to our rooms quickly.  The rooms all looked the same though the triple was slightly larger.  The rooms were fairly good sized with good storage and places to open luggage, etc.  The bathrooms were clean, but could have used some update.  Towels and sheets were clean.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful.  We called upon them to find a driver and van for excursions two different days.  The first day we went to the designer outlets and the 2nd day we were…

title: What a great hotel!!!!!!
review: Three of us stayed 7 nights (2 rooms) in mid-October, 2006 at the Londra in Florence.  My husband and I have different views on this hotel and I admit my less positive opinion stems from one bad experience.  When I missed a step and went flying across the floor on the first afternoon of our stay, I was appalled that the hotel management admitted (with a shrug) that that last step of the main staircase really needs to be marked.  Obviously I wasn't the first to create a spectacle there in the middle of the lobby.  As we left I noticed that the problem was still there - a dangerously bad joke for unsuspecting guests.  That aside, the hotel is conveniently located near the train station, restaurants, shopping, and several major tour attractions.  It caters to tour groups as well as…

title: kindly  staff and good accomodation
review: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights as it was chosen by our tour group, so we had no choice.  It is in a bad neighborhood near the train station.  The hallways are dark and dirty with old carpet.  Our room was small, outdated and smelly, with yellowish, brownish water coming out of the shower faucet.  It was hot at night so we asked the desk about the air-conditioning and they told us that it goes off when the temperature hits 20 degrees celsius.  The first night we kept our french door open, but got a lousy night's sleep due to all the street noise.  The blind covering that door was filthy.  Some other guests complained of a sewer smell in their rooms.  This hotel has supposedly been given a 4 star rating, so beware.

title: Disgusting Rooms
review: The hotel façade was not too promising (dull 70s architecture) but our room seemed recently refurbished, and quite tasteful too. Beyond the decoration and the furniture, the room had two real bonus: a nice balcony overlooking Oltrarno and a whirlpool bathtub that was truly welcome after those tough walking sessions that every Florence tourist has to endure. I have to admit that the most pleasure I got in Florence was not supplied by Michelangelo, Brunelleschi or any of those fine artists, but by the bathtub of the Londra hotel! The only detail that in my opinion was not too serious is the huge difference between the hotel official price list and the offer prices. So take your time to find a good deal or you will experience the frustrating sensation of sharing the same hotel with…
