title: Make Sure you get what you want!
review: This modern hotel is located just west of the Santa Maria Novella Train Station (main train station) near the heart of Florence. We had a room that appeared to have been renovated relatively recently. It was modern and extremely clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bath was a bit more modern than I would prefer - the shower stall had folding panels that took a little getting used to in order to avoid getting water all over the floor. There is no lip around the shower (and no tub). So, water eventually finds its way to a drain, but may cover a good part of the tile floor before doing so. So, be smarter than I was.  The restaurant serves good quality dinners and wines - though the service was a bit too leisurely for my tastes and the prices were quite high.  The best part of…

title: Near train station in Florence
review: We travelled to Florence with another couple on a month's tour of Italy. We had stayed in some nice hotels and walked out of one. On our arrival in florence we located the hotel which is about 500 metres from the station and from first appearances it looked fine. We were shown to our "non-smoking" rooms as the maid was removing the ashtrays and spraying deodarant.  The initial view of the hallways was the that the hotel was a bit shabby and in need of repair. Unfortunately the rooms were no better with wall paper hanging off and cracked tiles in the bathrooms. We called reception and asked to be relocated to better rooms. We were shown to different rooms and again the maid was there with the Aerosol. The rooms were not much better.  One of the things that had led us to this…

title: Good location, good value.
review: The hotel is a short walk from the train station if you are planning on taking any day trips to Pisa or any of the other small towns.  There are some good restaurants nearby but it seems to be the "seedier" side of Florence.   You can access the Hop On - Hop Off bus tour easily here as well as the train but that's about it.  You have to find a way to the other side of town to visit the duomo, ponte vecchio and other sites.  Florence is a great town if you love to walk.  The hotel - I give an average rating because it reminded me of staying in a typical US Holiday Inn.  The rooms seem to be a bit dated.  The full size beds are just twins pushed together and they are hard as a rock!!!  Same with the pillows - hard as a rock!!!  The bathrooms can be hit or miss.  Ours was fine but…

title: Good Hotel, Location Out of the Way
review: We stayed here last March in a triple room for 2 nights we got a deal on the web for €150 for both nights and thought it very good value. The room was clean and there were nice toiletries. It is very convenient for the station. (We caught the train from Pisa airport only€5 return) All the sights were easily walkable - the Duomo, is only about 10 mins walk away.  The breakfast was better than most and served in the very funky dining room. A good choice if you can get a deal!

title: Very Nice Stay At The Londra
review: My husband and I just returned from staying at Hotel Londra in Florence.  We had to have our room changed several times...the first room smelled of pesticides, the second room the air conditioning did not work and all three of the rooms were dirty.  The staff is very arrogrant and  unprofessional.  We felt the location was not in a very good area.  I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an enjoyable stay in Florence.

title: Never s!!
review: Nice hotel.  VERY helpful staff.  Great little lounge...try the Londra Special.  Rooms were nice.  Clean.  Location could have been a little better but it is a safe area.  Convenient to visting the historic district by foot.  Great dinner suggestions.

title: Not a bad location, lavish appearance, service can be better
review: This hotel is NOT safe.  They still use actual keys for their rooms - not magnetic cards, etc.  While we were sleeping, someone broke into our room and stole all of our money.  Oh, and the room was disgusting to begin with, but that would have been tolerable had the hotel been safe, at least.
